headline: Available job as DevOps Python Developer, Stockholm
description.text:
Experis IT in Stockholm is now looking for a senior DevOps Python Developer on behalf of our client. You'll get to chance to work with HW/SW integration together with a positive team of other developers. Don't miss out on this unique chance, welcome with your application!

Location: Stockholm
Start: ASAP
Assignment: Consultant assignment until 31/3, chance to extension

About the job

We are searching for a person with a broad experience, where the activities varies from hardware and software integration to developing new functionality in Python.

Work description:

 * Integration of hardware and software
 * Software development of in-house tools written in Python
 * Automation in Ansible and Salt

 * Providing relevant system documentation
 * Investigate identified defects, perform advanced fault searching, and produce fault reports and problem solving
 * Standardizing large scale IT environments and implement automation of technical solutions.
 * Understanding and designing monitoring of IT systems and IPCC





You have previous experience from working in similar roles. As a person it's important that you have a positive mindset, are a true team player and have a good eye for details.

Qualifications:


 * 3+ Years' Experience in writing Python 2 & 3 code

 * Fluent in English, written and spoken

 Meritorious:

 * Experience from working with EFT (electronic fund transfer) solutions
 * Experience from Retail
 * Experience from working with POS (point of sales) solutions
 * Experience of PCI DSS/PA-DSS


 * Swedish, written and spoken

Vad vi på Experis IT kan erbjuda dig:

Experis är ett av Sveriges största konsultbolag inom IT, Engineering och Finance. Vi är en av få bolag som samarbetar med företag, myndigheter och organisationer inom privat och offentlig sektor i hela Sverige. Våra konsultchefer har gedigen kunskap inom just ditt område. Som konsult hos oss är din karriär och utveckling alltid i fokus. Vår verksamhet bygger på att våra anställda trivs och utvecklas. Vi erbjuder en trygg anställning med allt vad det innebär: månadslön, kollektivavtal, försäkringar m.m. Läs mer om hur det är att vara konsult på https://www.experis.se/swe/vart-erbjudande/konsult/

Ansökan

Varmt välkommen med din ansökan genom att registrera ditt CV, urval sker löpande.

headline: Cloud Engineer with passion for DevOps Toolchains
description.text:
Scania is currently undergoing an exciting transformation from a traditional truck manufacturer to a provider of complete sustainable transport solutions. IT is a crucial part of this transformation as Scania’s success is depending on flexible and efficient IT solutions that support current and future business requirements.

At Infrastructure Services, the “Devtools team” is responsible to deliver a service of software development tools to the IT developers community at Scania. It is based on the latest technology and methodology in cloud environment. 

If you are interested in thinking in new paths and creating new solutions this could be the right challenge for you.

Your responsibilities

You will be involved in Development, automation and continuous improvement for tool and service delivery within Scania Devtools. You are responsible for service architecture and for identifying design or architectural issues within the services and plan appropriate steps.

You will also establish and maintain relationships with the Development Community Stakeholders regarding the needs and usage of existing and future tooling.

An important role is also to communicate, guide and inform our users on how the service works through different channels, meetings, writing instructions, making instruction videos, advice education, etc.

Your profile

You are passionate to learn new technology, tools and methods and have experience in assisting and coaching other developers in cloud, tools usage and methods.

You have some Solution Architect skills and want to develop them further inside the area of Development tools. You love to share your knowledge & ideas.

We think that it is important that you are a result oriented team player.

Our team and our responsibilities

Within our service we are currently responsible for tools like JIRA, GitHub, GitLab, Artifactory, Perforce and Visual Studio. We are also the centre of excellence for adoption and usage of the service. 

If you see what we do is interesting, you are very welcome to get in touch with us!

We offer

In addition to exciting career and personal development opportunities, we offer Scania employees a competitive salary and other benefits, performance bonuses, a pension plan, flexible working hours and much more.

Additional information



Application


 Please apply through our website Reflex/Job search at Scania as soon as possible and no later than 2020-02-16. 


Scania is a part of Traton Group and one of the world´s leading manufacturers of trucks and buses for heavy transport applications. Scania is also leading provider of industrial and marine engines. Service-related products account for a growing proportion of the company´s operations, assuring Scania customers of cost-effective transport solutions and maximum uptime. Scania also offers financial services.
Scania’s IT organisation is an integrated part of the company providing products and services to all business units worldwide. Based on deep Scania business knowledge and internal relations we balance in-house core competences and service production with services externally sourced and governed by us. We are around 1500 people and the majority is located in Sodertalje.

headline: DevOps Engineer to Cision in Stockholm
description.text: We are searching for you who want to build and develop our DevOps-area in the world leading IR- and PR-company Cision, Stockholm.      At Cision you will have the opportunity to put your own flair on this new DevOps-role where you will lead the work towards automated processes and develop the build processes for business-critical applications.Do you want to act as an ambassador within the DevOps-area on this expansive and forward leaning organisation?Apply for the role as DevOps Engineer now!      THE OPPORTUNITY       • The opportunity to develop and build the framework for current and future DevOps-work.    • Work with Cision´s self-developed and market leading products which are used by a majority of the companies on Stockholm´s stock-market and well-known brands.    • A role in a modern company with a strong culture and team spirit, who work according to the moto "freedom under responsibility", and where your enjoyment and well-being is important.      YOUR CHALLENGE      In this role you will be part of the Sprint work with a focus on automation and operation which involve working close to ProdOps.You will also be part of several processes, such as release-, incident- and problem-management.You will also:       • Be part of and drive general questions regarding the architecture and how the IT-environment should look and be developed over time.    • Automate CI/CD in the release process for the business-critical applications as well as take responsibility to build and further develop the release management.    • Actively be part of deployments to production.      THE TEAM AND WORK PLACE      You will be part of the agile scrum team who today consist of 6 developers and 2 QA:s. We are located in the attractive Garnisonen at Östermalm in Stockholm.      ABOUT YOU      We are looking for you who enjoy working in a flexible, ever-changing and growing environment, where you are driven by the interest of new technology and stay up to date within your area of expertise.You are engaged as a person with a curious mind who find pleasure working at a workplace where teamwork and knowledge sharing is at the organizations core.      You have a good understanding of Scrum and Agile methods as well as continuous integration and -delivery.You master any of the following script languages: PowerShell, Python or Javascript.A lot at Cision is based upon the Windows environment but there are also a few Linux servers as well.It is a plus If you have earlier experience of cloud platforms within AWS regarding automation.      Cision is an international organization which requires fluency in English, both in written and spoken language.Swedish is meritorious, not a demand.      LET´S CONNECT   Their recruitment process focuses on transparency, inclusion and a fast moving candidate experience.And now we want to know more about you – on your own terms!To apply, please fill out the short form, briefly motivate why you are interested in the position, and attach your CV or LinkedIn-profile.No additional documentation is needed.You can then, in real-time, follow your application online as our recruiters are working with it.We work with a continues selection process which means we might hire a candidate before the final apply date, so apply already today!Interested and want to know more?Please contact our recruiter today.We are looking forward to connecting soon!

headline: DevOps
description.text: Devinix Solutions AB is a Swedish provider of hybrid cloud solutions, traditional IT operations and network solutions.The company was founded in 2014, but has since 2004 been active in ISP, hosting and operations.   Our goal is to renew and improve the existing environment of our partners with the efficient use of our proprietary DVXcloud and custom services in order to create a stable, future-proof and cost-effective overall solution.Partnerships exist with most major suppliers like Microsoft (Silver Partner), VMware, Veeam and many others.Our platform extends over 3 data centers in the Stockholm area with redundant fiber networks.   Minimum qualifications:   •Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics or related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.   •Experience maintaining internet facing production-grade applications in virtualized environments such as cloud computing platforms and services.   •Experience writing scripts in one or more languages such as Python, Go and/or similar.   •Experience working with development, deployment and orchestration technologies (such as Git, Docker, Kubernetes, Jenkins).   •Experience serving in the capacity of a technical consultant or advisor, or equivalent client-facing engineering or technical consulting experience.   Preferred qualifications:   •Experience working with scalable networking technologies such as Load Balancers/Firewalls and web standards (REST APIs, web security mechanisms).   •Experience working with deployment and orchestration technologies (such as Mesos, OpenStack, Ansible and Spinnaker).   •Understanding of open source server software (such as NGINX, RabbitMQ, Redis, Elasticsearch).   •Familiarity with standard IT security practices such as encryption, certificates and key management.We are now looking for DevOps and Infrastructure Engineers to maintain and develop an efficient development environment for our customers.Your role will include all development activities such as: requirement analysis, system design, architecture design, software design, integration, verification, simulations, tools design and product documentation.   We stand at the forefront of Agile software development, using methods like Lean and Scrum to create a product that excels.Early customer and stakeholder feedback is a key element in our development process which is based on Continuous Integration SW practices.We rely on team collective responsibility to complete all tasks according to an established backlog priority.   To expand our organization’s capacity, we are looking for ambitious, intelligent, creative and inspiring individuals to join us.We provide a fun and challenging environment where you can grow and help to inspire your colleagues to further growth.

headline: DevOps
description.text: Är du vår nya DevOps konsult?      Softhouse har arbetat i olika projekt tillsammans med våra kunder sedan 1996 och har en bra mix av både interna och externa uppdrag.Vi är experter på mjukvaruhantverket.Det är en del av vår ryggrad precis som det agila arbetssättet som genomsyrar alla projekt och utmaningar vi jobbar med.      Vem är du?      - Du har erfarenhet av mjukvaruutveckling och/eller testning av komplexa system.   - Du har tidigare arbetat i ett DevOps team och förstår betydelsen av CI/CD.   - Du har kunskap om containers, ex Docker, arbetat med verktyg som ex Jenkins, Drone samt scripting.   - Vi ser gärna att du även har erfarenhet av Google Cloud-arkitektur och Microservices.   - Du har en bred teknisk kompetens och håller dig uppdaterad med de senaste trenderna inom ditt område.   - Du bryr dig om detaljerna och vet vad som krävs för att leverera grymma applikationer med hög kvalitet.      Vi erbjuder:      - Du får möjlighet att jobb i team med kollegor från Softhouse även i externa uppdrag.   - Vi mixar inhouse projektet med externa uppdrag, allt efter ditt och kundens bästa intresse.   - Kunskapsdelning är en stor del av vårt dna, därmed erbjuds och uppmuntras kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling.   - Vårt förmånspaket kommer inte göra dig besviken, men det kan vi ta när vi ses.      Om oss      Softhouse Consulting var ett av de allra första bolagen att introducera agil metodik i Sverige och vi skrev vårt första agila kontrakt redan 2002.Sedan dess har vi stöttat några av Sveriges främsta bolag att utveckla sina mjukvaruverksamheter.Vi har nu rådgivit och coachat åtskilliga (https://www.softhouse.se/vara-erbjudanden/verksamhetsutveckling), utbildat flera tusen   (http://softhouseeducation.se/kursutbud/16071-2) och givit ut över   (https://issuu.com/softhouse) inom lean och agilt ledarskap.2016 tog vi ett nytt viktigt steg genom att introducera Softhouse Invest AB.I en marknad där hjulen rullar allt snabbare och kraven hela tiden ökar på specialisering och professionalism behövs nya samarbetsformer.Genom vår investeringsverksamhet kan vi fördjupa samarbetet med våra kunder ytterligare, erbjuda aktivt kapital där vår partner ges möjlighet att dra nytta av vår mjukvaruexpertis och samtidigt stärkas finansiellt.

headline: DEVOPS
description.text: The Position   We strongly believe that developer efficiency is a differentiating factor between a blockbuster success and a failure and this is where you as the DevOps come in.You are part of the team responsible for availability, latency, resource efficiency, overall performance, change management, monitoring, and capacity planning for core services.Working with a large codebase spanning multiple languages and domains, you will work to improve game team efficiency by automating processes and developing services.   We believe that a successful candidate has strong programming skills and a distinct sense of craftsmanship; preferably with experience working on continuous integration environments and cloud systems.If you believe that rapid iterations is key to making great games and have hands-on experience improving developer workflows we would like to meet you.   This is a great opportunity to join the IT and engine team and contribute to an environment where our developers are efficient and productive.Being a part of this team means that a lot of people will rely on your expertise and the optimal candidate will thrive under such circumstances.   We offer you a challenging, relaxed and stimulating environment where you will work with some of the industriy's brightest minds while constantly applying and deepening your skills.   Required Qualifications   Strong Python (or Go, Javascript, Erlang, etc.)programmerSolid experience developing for - and administration - of LinuxExperience with configuration management systems such as Ansible, Chef, Puppet Experience with version control systems such as Perforce, Git, SubversionExperience with continuous integration systems Jenkins, TeamCity, Bamboo, etc.Familiar developing and using REST-like APIsGood verbal and written communication skills   Bonus Qualifications   Experience with virtualization (ESX, etc.)       We will only consider applications that consist of both a cover letter and a CV.In your cover letter you should include why you want to work at Avalanche Studios and which games you are currently playing.For this role you need to be able to work full-time in our Stockholm office.To apply for this position please register below.Apply as soon as possible as we review applications continuously.All further information is provided under non-disclosure agreement only.    Our Values   At Avalanche Studios, we believe in worlds without limits, and we are committed to developing a diverse and inclusive workplace.We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company.Being part of our world is not contingent on where you’re from, your gender, or sexual orientation.It’s all about your passion, courage and craftsmanship.    Stockholm Studio   Our state of the art studio is located in the beautiful area of Södermalm, in the center of Stockholm and the Game industry Hub.Our studio is a beautiful place inspired by our catalog of games.We hope you’ll come to think of this place as your home turf and creative foundation.   Avalanche Studios   Interactive) and Rage 2 (published by Bethesda Softworks).As a publisher, Avalanche Studios has released theHunter: Call of the Wild, Generation Zero and the free-to-play service theHunter Classic which has reached more than 8 million players across 190 countries.Avalanche Studios was founded in 2003 and is based in Stockholm, New York City and Malmö.The studio develops games using its proprietary Apex technology, enabling huge open worlds filled with emergent gameplay.Learn more at www.avalanchestudios.com.   APPLY NOW

headline: DevOps
description.text:
Är du vår nya DevOps konsult?

Softhouse har arbetat i olika projekt tillsammans med våra kunder sedan 1996 och har en bra mix av både interna och externa uppdrag. Vi är experter på mjukvaruhantverket. Det är en del av vår ryggrad precis som det agila arbetssättet som genomsyrar alla projekt och utmaningar vi jobbar med.

Vem är du?

- Du har erfarenhet av mjukvaruutveckling och/eller testning av komplexa system.
- Du har tidigare arbetat i ett DevOps team och förstår betydelsen av CI/CD.
- Du har kunskap om containers, ex Docker, arbetat med verktyg som ex Jenkins, Drone samt scripting.
- Vi ser gärna att du även har erfarenhet av Google Cloud-arkitektur och Microservices.
- Du har en bred teknisk kompetens och håller dig uppdaterad med de senaste trenderna inom ditt område.
- Du bryr dig om detaljerna och vet vad som krävs för att leverera grymma applikationer med hög kvalitet.

Vi erbjuder:

- Du får möjlighet att jobb i team med kollegor från Softhouse även i externa uppdrag.
- Vi mixar inhouse projektet med externa uppdrag, allt efter ditt och kundens bästa intresse.
- Kunskapsdelning är en stor del av vårt dna, därmed erbjuds och uppmuntras kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling.
- Vårt förmånspaket kommer inte göra dig besviken, men det kan vi ta när vi ses.

Om oss

Softhouse Consulting var ett av de allra första bolagen att introducera agil metodik i Sverige och vi skrev vårt första agila kontrakt redan 2002. Sedan dess har vi stöttat några av Sveriges främsta bolag att utveckla sina mjukvaruverksamheter. Vi har nu rådgivit och coachat åtskilliga (https://www.softhouse.se/vara-erbjudanden/verksamhetsutveckling), utbildat flera tusen   (http://softhouseeducation.se/kursutbud/16071-2) och givit ut över   (https://issuu.com/softhouse) inom lean och agilt ledarskap. 2016 tog vi ett nytt viktigt steg genom att introducera Softhouse Invest AB. I en marknad där hjulen rullar allt snabbare och kraven hela tiden ökar på specialisering och professionalism behövs nya samarbetsformer. Genom vår investeringsverksamhet kan vi fördjupa samarbetet med våra kunder ytterligare, erbjuda aktivt kapital där vår partner ges möjlighet att dra nytta av vår mjukvaruexpertis och samtidigt stärkas finansiellt.

headline: DevOps
description.text:
Devinix Solutions AB is a Swedish provider of hybrid cloud solutions, traditional IT operations and network solutions. 




Our goal is to renew and improve the existing environment of our partners with the efficient use of our proprietary DVXcloud and custom services in order to create a stable, future-proof and cost-effective overall solution. Partnerships exist with most major suppliers like Microsoft (Silver Partner), VMware, Veeam and many others. Our platform extends over 3 data centers in the Stockholm area with redundant fiber networks.




Minimum qualifications:

•Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics or related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.

•Experience maintaining internet facing production-grade applications in virtualized environments such as cloud computing platforms and services.

•Experience writing scripts in one or more languages such as Python, Go and/or similar.

•Experience working with development, deployment and orchestration technologies (such as Git, Docker, Kubernetes, Jenkins).

•Experience serving in the capacity of a technical consultant or advisor, or equivalent client-facing engineering or technical consulting experience.




Preferred qualifications:

•Experience working with scalable networking technologies such as Load Balancers/Firewalls and web standards (REST APIs, web security mechanisms).

•Experience working with deployment and orchestration technologies (such as Mesos, OpenStack, Ansible and Spinnaker).

•Understanding of open source server software (such as NGINX, RabbitMQ, Redis, Elasticsearch).

•Familiarity with standard IT security practices such as encryption, certificates and key management. We are now looking for DevOps and Infrastructure Engineers to maintain and develop an efficient development environment for our customers. Your role will include all development activities such as: requirement analysis, system design, architecture design, software design, integration, verification, simulations, tools design and product documentation.




Early customer and stakeholder feedback is a key element in our development process which is based on Continuous Integration SW practices. We rely on team collective responsibility to complete all tasks according to an established backlog priority.

We provide a fun and challenging environment where you can grow and help to inspire your colleagues to further growth.

headline: DevOps
description.text:
Come and join our great team here at Patrix! We develop a world leading platform aimed to help and protect Intellectual Property such as patents, inventions and creations and at the same time have a really good time together doing so. Does having collegues and customers around the world while working at the HQ here in Gothenburg in a grand house built in the 1700s sounds exciting? Now is your opportunity!



We are expanding the development team with a DevOps Engineer.

This is what you’ll do…

Manage and evolve production and development environments including planning for size, capacity and performance.Implement security best practices to ensure compliance and adherence to standards.Plan and build a deployment framework/workflow to enable efficient release of products into production.Proactively monitor the environment to ensure operations related requirements and SLAs.

This is the job for you, if you…

Have experience in

Docker and InfrastructureSome developmentLinux operations and system administrationMonitoring tools

You do not need to have years of experience with all parts but a strong interest and that you like to find information and to learn new technology is important.

Since you will have collegues around the globe, good communication skills in English, written and spoken, is needed.

At Patrix we work close toghether both within the teams but also cross functional in the company and put a lot of value into that.

We travel abroad from time to time, e.g. to the annual employee meetup that is most often held somewhere in Europe. Once a week we have breakfast with the collegues and once a month also a lunch. From time to time there are different social and fun activities.

About us

https://youtu.be/g944dph7VxU


We specialise in a management system for intellectual property experts and have around 700 clients all around the world. 

Now we are looking to increase our team in Gothenburg!

headline: DEVOPS ARCHITECT
description.text: ALTEN IT Stockholm is now looking for a skilled Senior DevOps Engineer or DevOps Architect ready to take the next step in their career.For this long-term assignment, you will play a major role in developing ALTEN’s growth and partnership with one of our biggest clients´ within the Transportation Industry.You will be responsible for coaching a team of skilled Software -and DevOps engineers at ALTEN’s head office in Stockholm, have a close collaboration with stakeholders, ALTEN IT Business Unit and ALTEN’s Technical Unit Management Team.Emphasis will be placed on personal suitability, technical knowledge and analytical skills.      Your main responsibilities will include:      - Identifying business requirements of our client, negotiate and design interfaces together with external parties and stakeholders   - Set up of best practice processes and coaching the project teams   - Introduce Continuous Delivery into the teams   - Designing the entire DevOps environment from bottom to top (IoT/embedded – cloud) based on the client´s requirements   - Choosing the system architecture and each individual component of the chosen system   - SW test strategy, the enforcement of it and the creation and maintenance of test environments in which automated tests are executed   - Choosing the technologies for the implementation of each component and connections between the components   - Code review and controlling the architecture during iteration of system release   - Writing project documentation and its support      It is therefore required that you possess the following skills:      - Experience in DevOps in production environment   - Experience in CI/CD (Jenkins, Kubernetes, Docker, Terraform, Spinnaker, Helm)   - Experience in interface design in SOA, loosely coupled architecture at the enterprise level   - Experience in designing Micro Services   - Experience in Cloud Deployment (AWS, Azure, GCP, Openstack)   - Experience in Enterprise busses / API GW   - Experience in Test Automation   - Experience in IoT Architecture and software stacks   - Good command of the English language   - Master’s degree in science      ABOUT ALTEN   ALTEN is a consulting company that develops and delivers expertise for world-leading companies with consultants in technology, IT and biochemistry.We are located in over 25 countries, have our headquarter in Paris and have more than 33 000 employees, of which 88 percent are engineers.In Sweden, we have over 1 700 employees and work from offices in twelve locations.Our clients are found in industries such as Automotive, Energy, Telecom, Industry, Aerospace & Defence and Life Science, where our consultants operate throughout the product development chain.   Welcome to read more about us at alten.se      WHAT WE OFFER YOU   Every employee is equally valuable in the success of ALTEN!We are driven by making people grow and develop, which is why we offer you the opportunity to work with what you are truly passionate about.At ALTEN, we have a broad range of assignments at most of the leading companies in Sweden in several different sectors, to make it possible for your wishes to come true.We offer both national and international opportunities and together with your coaching manager, you build your career path so you constantly are able to develop and achieve your goals and dreams!   As a consultant at ALTEN, you will get the genuine team feeling at your assignment but also a wonderful togetherness at ALTEN.All activities are of course optional.Work life balance is our top priority.We also have a collective agreement and other benefits like Pension, Insurances and Wellness grants.      We believe in growing together.            We look forward to receiving your application!

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text: We now expand our Devops team with 6 new colleagues!      The team's responsibility will be to create and expand a new operating environment for one of our key customers within the Telecom industry.The environment is completely Opensource based, built on Openstack, Docker and Kubernetes, amongst other technologies.The purpose is for our customer to migrate services and applications when the environment is operational to replace existing legacy systems.      In this role you will have an active role in implementation and deployment, performing installations and configurations to get the environment up-and-running and service ready.      The team will work agile with daily stand-ups with the team's scrum-masters and weekly project meetings.      The location of work out in teams from one of our offices in Stockholm, Linköping or Gothenburg.            We are looking for you who have:      - Experience from IT-operations, preferably in a Linux environment   - Experience implementing and working with Docker & Kubernetes   - Coding, scripting skills (e.g, Bash, Python)   - Automation experience (Ansible or similar)   - Forward thinking and open mindset   - Understanding of agile principles         Nice-to-haves:      - Openstack experience   - Git   - Jira & Confluence   - Prometheus   - Nginx   - Keycloak   - CEPH   - ISPIO         Above is technologies that you will get to work with within the role and the project.            To fit the team and the role, we believe you are:      - A great problem solver and ability to deal with technical challenges   - A team player that contributes to a good atmosphere and, knowledge sharing and work environment.   - Someone who wants to work with modern technologies and strive for new learnings   - Want to have influence over technology choices and architecture               Fluent English in spoken and written terms are a requirement along with mandatory background check.            Our offering      ELITS can offer you a varied job as a consultant.We have interesting, long-term assignments where you can develop and work close to colleagues who share your passion for technology and to deliver Another Kind of IT.      As a ELITS employee, you will receive a range of benefits such as the opportunity for profit sharing, partnership, healthcare and massage grants, private health insurance, private pension advicing and an individual development plan.            The selection process is ongoing, so submit your application today!      If you have any questions, do not hesitate to contact the way that suits you best, chat, email or phone!

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text: Kambi is a leading B2B provider of premium sports betting services for online and retail gambling operators.Our mission is to create the world’s leading sports betting experience, from front-end user interface to customer intelligence, risk management and odds compiling.With offices in Stockholm, Uppsala, London, Malta, Bucharest, Philadelphia and Sydney together with 800 passionate and highly skilled people, we live and breathe sports betting.      Job Description      Have you been through a change involving container architecture infrastructure and you know that it is more than just technology shift?      As part of our strategy to continuously improve our way of working, we are building a new Engineering Experience team to help us provide the best possible experience for our developers.The team’s responsibility is to provide common infrastructure baseline for microservice architecture so that the developers can focus on the business logic.The Engineering Experience team will provide tools and process alignment to allow the rest of our engineers do their job as smoothly as possible.You will have the opportunity to influence the culture of the Development organization, facilitate technical delivery and work with the team´s strategy definition and implementation.      What you will do:      • Your main responsibility will be to provide stable and reliable infrastructure baselines for the development teams in collaboration with IT Operations   • You will support the Development teams to grow and deliver healthy software, by facilitating tools and process alignment   • You will interact with distributed development teams across several locations      You'd like to work with these technologies:      • Linux and OpenBSD   • Networking and Automation   • Test and release framework and tools   • Globally hosted servers and network equipment   • Virtualization environments   • Container architecture infrastructure (e.g.Kubernetes)      We expect you to:      • Be curious, self-driven, team player, pragmatic and persistent   • Enjoy working in a self-organizing, self-managing team   • Have strong background in Linux and/or Networking   • Have experience with test/release infrastructure   • Have demonstrated experience with agile development software release   • Be comfortable with technologies like load balancing, routing, firewalls, VPNs, monitoring and virtualization      What’s in it for you?      • Opportunity to work in a successful and fast-growing company   • A fun and flexible working culture   • Work with smart and humble people   • International work environment   • Opportunities to travel      If you want to be part of a new development team in central Stockholm, please apply with a cover letter and your CV.      Candidates must be available for in-person interviews in Stockholm.

headline: DevOps Tekniker
description.text: Data Ductus är ett modernt, flexibelt företag som erbjuder högkvalitativa IT-tjänster för stora och medelstora företag och organisationer.Vi arbetar nära våra kunder och bygger långsiktiga relationer där våra tjänsteområden är affärsutveckling, systemutveckling, systemintegration samt drift, förvaltning & support.På vårt kontor i Uppsala är vi närmare 80 medarbetare.    Vi söker dig som   Har ett brinnande intresse och erfarenhet inom Linux och molntjänster.Du har erfarenhet av att arbeta med olika Linux-dialekter och gillar att skriva script för att förenkla vardagen.Vi tror att du är van att hantera Docker-containers och närliggande tekniker som t ex lastbalansering.   Vi är intresserade av dig med lång erfarenhet, men även dig som är i början av din karriär.Du bör dock ha ett par års erfarenhet för att vara kvalificerad för tjänsten.    Vi erbjuder   Du kommer att arbeta i en öppen och prestigelös organisation, med bra gemenskap och utan hierarkier.Samarbete, kommunikation och snabb feedback är ledord som är väl förankrade och genomsyrar hela organisationen.    Vi lägger stor vikt vid personlig utveckling och inte minst på våra medarbetares kompetens.Vi erbjuder löpande kompetensutveckling med stora möjligheter att påverka den själv.   Vi vill förstås känna att vi har roligt på jobbet, och desto viktigare är det också att vi kan erbjuda en bra balans mellan arbetsliv och privatliv.För oss är gemenskap och sammanhållning viktigt och därför arrangerar vi sociala aktiviteter.   Din arbetsplats kommer att vara i centrala Uppsala där du oftast arbetar inhouse tillsammans med kollegor som besitter djup teknisk kompetens.Data Ductus strävar efter att ligga i teknikens framkant för att kunna möta och överträffa kundernas förväntningar.Du har stor möjlighet att själv påverka i vilka projekt du arbetar dels utifrån intresse samt att du ska få möjlighet att fortsätta utvecklas i den riktning du önskar.   Du har goda kunskaper inom följande områden:   • Linux   • Shell script   • Webbservrar (Apache, Nginx)   • Automationsverktyg (t ex Ansible, Saltstack eller Puppet)    • Övervakning   • Serverinfrastruktur   Utöver detta ser vi gärna att du har andra erfarenheter och kompetensområden.Vi ser gärna att du har erfarenhet av molntekniker och tjänster från t ex Google, Amazon eller Microsoft.    Meriterande kunskapsområden inom scriptning: Python, Bash, .Net/C# samt nedan:   • Lagring   • Nätverk   • Docker/Kubernetes   • SQL/NoSQL   • Deployment   • Microsoft Server   • MS SQL   Du bör behärska svenska och engelska väl och ha en förmåga att dokumentera på ett tydligt sätt.   Personliga egenskaper   Vi ser gärna att du besitter kunskap och erfarenhet som ger dig möjlighet att se helheten i en IT-driftleverans.Förutom kunskap inom specifika områden (se kravlistan ovan) har du förmågan att se IT-leveranser utifrån ett helikopterperspektiv.Det är viktigt att du har ett grundligt driv i ditt arbete.Du behöver ha en framåtlutad inställning till din egen leverans.Din känsla för service är hög – Du hanterar både kunder och kollegor på ett inbjudande och förtroendeingivande sätt.Du trivs som lagspelare och arbetar gärna i team men kan även driva uppgifter och mindre projekt på egen hand.   Om tjänsten   Tjänsten är heltid och tillträde enligt överenskommelse.   Ort: Uppsala   Frågor      Ansökan   Varmt välkommen med din ansökan så snart som möjligt.Tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas inom kort och därför sker rekryteringsarbetet löpande under ansökningstiden.

headline: DevOps Expert
description.text: About Axis Communications   Axis enables a smarter and safer world by creating network solutions that provide insights for improving security and new ways of doing business.As the industry leader in network video, Axis offers products and services for video surveillance and analytics, access control, and audio systems.Axis has more than 3,000 dedicated employees in over 50 countries and collaborates with partners worldwide to deliver customer solutions.      For more information about Axis, please visit our website www.axis.com .   Reference number: 2861   Axis är världsledande inom nätverkskameror och säkerhetslösningar och har 3 500 anställda i över 50 länder.Vi befinner oss i en expansiv fas där mjukvara och tjänster blir en allt viktigare del av vårt erbjudande.Vår device software  axOS utvecklas till största delen i Lund.   Teamet   Vi är ett team inom Axis R&D Software, Platform Management, som är övergripande ansvariga för att koordinera och släppa axOS och uppgradera våra hårdvaruprodukter med ny mjukvara.På Platform Management har vi en ständig dialog med ett femtiotal pågående produktprojekt som designar och utvecklar våra nätverksprodukter: kameror, recorders, video analytics- och radarprodukter, högtalare, etc.Alla är beroende av att vår mjukvara är i topptrim och vi på Platform Management leder detta arbete i nära samarbete med vår testavdelning (QA) och de ansvariga utvecklingsavdelningarna.Vår CI/CD-kedja ska ligga i framkant och vi har uppdraget att effektivisera denna kedja till gagn för hela företaget.   Uppdraget   Vi söker nu en CI/CD expert och förändringsledare som kan hjälpa oss vidare på en resa vi redan inlett.Du kommer att tillsammans med kollegor underlätta transformationen till DevOps, arbeta med förbättringar och stötta team och individer i denna förändring.   Vem är du?    Du är en passionerad ledare som brinner för modern och cyklisk mjukvaruutveckling.Du tycker om att arbeta i ett smart utvecklingskollektiv och har intresse och energi att driva frågor tillsammans.Det är viktigt att du har ett holistiskt synsätt, är analytisk, öppen och nyfiken.   Kompetensprofil   Vi tror att du är M Sc D/E/F, har arbetat med förändringsledning och är väl förtrogen med begreppen DevOps, Continuous Integration och Continuous Delivery.Du har erfarenhet av agila arbetssätt och datadriven utveckling.Det är också en fördel om du arbetat med Jira, Git, Gerrit, Jenkins och ElasticSearch.   Vad kan vi erbjuda dig?    På Axis är vi öppna för nya idéer och du kommer att ha stora möjligheter att utvecklas både på ett personligt och professionellt plan.Vi litar på ditt driv, men du kan också räkna med full support och stöttning från oss i teamet och andra Axiskollegor.   Frågor?

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text: Varnish Software is the company behind Varnish Cache, a widely recognized open-source HTTP proxy that significantly enhances web performance and enables digital content delivery.Varnish Cache has experienced a tremendous growth since its inception and currently powers more than 4.7 million websites globally.      Varnish Software is growing on a global market and is now entering a new phase where the Mainstream Enterprise Customers’ market will be addressed even stronger.To prepare for this ramp-up, Varnish Software strengthens its R&D Team with new members.      We are seeking an experienced and hands-on DevOps engineer with a passion for Automation, Linux, Open Source, scalability and software infrastructure, to join our Tools and Platforms team in Karlstad.   The Team      The primary objective of the Tools and Platforms team is to make Varnish easier to deploy, configure, monitor and scale.The typical environments we are targeting are running multiple instances in multiple locations.      This objective is achieved by developing easy-to-use administration tools, monitoring tools and working with cloud providers such as AWS, Google and Microsoft to make Varnish available and easy to use in their ecosystems.      The Tools and Platforms team consists of backend and frontend developers and people with several years of experience.They complete each other, and together they architect and build components that are well tested and compatible with modern hosting environments and deployment tools.   The Role      As a DevOps, you will strengthen our team working with our customers to install, configure, automate, monitor both customer infrastructure and our own infrastructure, this can range from a couple of servers to hundreds of servers.      We have a lot of interesting work ahead of us in expanding our Varnish offering, Varnish feature set and scaling to meet demand.We are passionate about Go and Python, clean APIs and have a bias towards shipping and believe that tests are key to higher velocity and reliability.If you share our passions then you’ll fit right in.      As part of the Tools and Platforms team, your primary responsibilities are to:      • Participating in the implementation of new system and infrastructure projects.   • Apply and adhere to good best practices within an agile/iterative development approach.   • Setup and monitor services, collect metrics and tune for performance.   • Work together with our partners with routines and documentation.   • Cloud infrastructure: Automation, configuration, deployment, monitoring   • CI/CD: Automated build, test, and deployment of applications and services   • Site Reliability: Design for operational quality, monitoring, and maintenance   • Monitoring and sanity checks of IT-services, using metrics to improve performance and quality.   • Contribute with experience to ensure that everything we build is compatible with modern environments and features specific to these such as auto-scaling, service discovery, and containerization.   • Be creative and brainstorm ideas for ways we can further streamline our development process.      You are:      • A Self-starter who can take work on an idea and quickly and iterate through feedback.   • Self-motivated and self-managing with strong organizational skills.   • Able to research best practices and create, validate and present your findings.   • Able to keep projects going from start to finish.      Relevant experience:      • Experience working with services from AWS, Azure or GCP or similar providers.   • Strong Linux experience, comfortable in both Debian and RHEL based systems.   • Experience in designing and building systems that scale.   • Basic programming skills, for example in Python, Ruby, Go.   • Knowledge of automation platforms such as Ansible, Puppet, Chef or Terraform   • Security   • English written and verbal communication skills.      What we offer      • Work in a modern IT environment on a global scale.   • Plenty of challenges and opportunities.   • Ability to influence product development, creating administration and analytics tools   • A happy, creative, non-hierarchical work environment in which you are a valued member of our organization   • Involvement in the complete lifecycle of software products   • Interaction and cooperation with top global customers   • An opportunity to showcase your work in community meetups and other conferences where applicable   • Contribute your expertise as part of the support rotation   • An international environment with offices and colleagues all over the world         Varnish Software is a laid-back place to work.But make no mistake: we do take very seriously the work of creating and sharing our software – and have fun doing it.We value flexibility, independence, and trust.      Seniority Level: Mid/Senior level   Industry: Information Technology & Services   Employment Type: Full-time   Job Functions: Information Technology      Rekryteringen sker i samarbete med Qtym.      Välkommen med sin ansökan!

Development, Consultancy and Testing Services to clients across the globe for onsite and offshore business model having a presence in Sweden as well as a dedicated ODC in India and Poland. and facilitate the company core business.- Finding new revenue opportunities by leveraging our vast data warehouses and more efficiently target key demographics for future campaigns.You will work as a Cloud Technician Expert in this area, together with vendors and architects in different areas with implementation and configuration plans.Be a part of pre-studies, proof-of concept projects and using and experience within Windows or Red Hat stack Possess strong demonstrable cloud skills in PowerShell or Bash scripting Prioritize efforts to efficiently handle troubleshooting, and develop tools and scripts to automate support activities Must haves: • Minimum of 5 years’ experience of operating and maintaining Cloud or Windows servers • Moderate networking skills, familiar with load balancers, OTP, 2FA, Express route, firewalls, routing • moderate to expert skills in Azure • ITIL Certification • A fact-based world view, likes measuring and statistics • Self-sufficient and used to working autonomously Optional: • IIS Experience • Windows Clustering Experience • Familiar with Azure-products • Familiar with PowerBI • SSAS/SSIS Experience • Experience with working with offshore teams Experience in working with Kanban/scrumban

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text: Plejd AB is looking for a DevOps/CloudOps engineer to join our developer team in Göteborg/Mölndal.      Ideally you enjoy a healthy mix of back-end development, Linux and open-source wizardry and a love for all things DevOps, automation and cloud security.      Come join us if you share our passion for working on cutting edge technology and want to help enable our vision to make the best smart lighting and home automation system in the industry.      Plejd is an awesome fast growing Swedish tech company that develops products and services for smart lighting and home automation.We are an in-house fullstack company that has a great mix of people from production, hardware devs, embedded devs, app developers and cloud/backend devs.      You will like it here if you:   -Have an interest in designing and developing next generation cloud infrastructure for highly scalable and available cloud applications   -Like keeping up with state of the art technology and the ever growing ecosystem around open-source, cloud-native and DevOps   -Are hands-on and thrive in a fast-paced and collaborative environment where you will be a key member of the team      You will mostly be:   - Evaluating overall production infrastructure in the areas of web services, database, and others in AWS environment.   - Helping to seamlessly scale production level systems   - Creating secure AWS based solutions and independently implement them in a timely manner   - Developing monitoring and logging solutions   - Monitoring performance and stability for our cloud-platform and proactively resolve issues as they arise   - Collaborating with internal development teams to create requirements and deliver solutions      We do not except you to know everything in the list below but it may serve as a good list of reference for some of the technologies you will need to learn or know about:      Cloud Architect experience in the areas of:   - Deployment automation   - High availability systems   - Cloud security   - Key/configuration management   - AWS CloudFormation   - Serverless architecture   - ElastiCache (including Redis)   - NodeJS environments   - ElasticSearch      HTTP and Network protocol knowledge:   - Load balancers   - Reverse proxies   - NATs, DNS, VPNs   - WebSockets   - REST APIs      Monitoring and Logging:   - ELK stack administration   - CloudWatch   - NewRelic      Continuous Integration / Continuous Delivery technology:   - Jenkins   - GitLab CI/CD pipelines      If this seems like the kind of environment you would like to work in, get in touch!      Plejd AB is not accepting unsolicited assistance from search firms for this employment opportunity.Please, no phone calls or emails.

headline: DEVOPS ENGINEER
description.text: One of our clients is looking for a DevOps Engineer who holds a development background and is passionate about high quality IT-services!In this role, you will work with implementing and maintaining the right tools to ensure smooth and seamless IT-deliveries with high quality.This is done by standardizing processes, stabilizing infrastructure, enabling automation and reducing human intervention.In this role, you will be responsible for the digital development logistics from start to finish as well as for operational IT-services.      These are some of your responsibilities:   -Cloud infrastructure: Automation, configuration, deployment, monitoring   -CI/CD: Automated build, test and deployment of applications and services   -Site Reliability: Design for operational quality, monitoring and maintenance   -Monitoring and sanity checks of IT-services, using metrics to improve performance and quality      -Experience in implementing and maintaining CI/CD pipelines   -Experience in utilizing metrics to drive improvements   -Experience in cloud environments (preferably Azure)   -Hold the ability to collaborate with others, take note of alternate viewpoints and implement the best solution      ABOUT ALTEN   ALTEN is a consulting company that develops and delivers expertise for world-leading companies with consultants in technology, IT and biochemistry.We are located in over 25 countries, have our headquarter in Paris and have more than 33 000 employees, of which 88 percent are engineers.In Sweden, we have over 1 700 employees and work from offices in twelve locations.Our clients are found in industries such as Automotive, Energy, Telecom, Industry, Aerospace & Defence and Life Science, where our consultants operate throughout the product development chain.   Welcome to read more about us at alten.se      WHAT WE OFFER YOU   Every employee is equally valuable in the success of ALTEN!We are driven by making people grow and develop, which is why we offer you the opportunity to work with what you are truly passionate about.At ALTEN, we have a broad range of assignments at most of the leading companies in Sweden in several different sectors, to make it possible for your wishes to come true.We offer both national and international opportunities and together with your coaching manager, you build your career path so you constantly are able to develop and achieve your goals and dreams!   As a consultant at ALTEN, you will get the genuine team feeling at your assignment but also a wonderful togetherness at ALTEN.All activities are of course optional.Work life balance is our top priority.We also have a collective agreement and other benefits like Pension, Insurances and Wellness grants.      We believe in growing together.         We look forward to receiving your application!

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text: OM TJÄNSTEN      Detta är en direktrekrytering vilket innebär att du kommer bli anställd direkt till Eurofins Digital testing.Vi använder oss av ett löpande urval och välkomnar din ansökan redan idag!      DINA ARBETSUPPGIFTER      I din roll som DevOps Engineer kommer du att arbeta i en mix av övervakning och utveckling av system som är driftsatta.Genom att analysera trafik, loggar, felrapporter kan både fel och flaskhalsar upptäckas och korrigeras.Du kommer att bygga och underhålla automatiserade tester och planera och utföra säkerhet och belastningstester.Du kommer att arbeta i olika typer av infrastruktur och använda många olika verktyg för drift, övervakning, integration etc.       START: Vid överenskommelse    OMFATTNING: Heltid    ARBETSTIDER:Kontorstider    PLACERINGSORT: Linköping      DIN PROFIL      Vi söker dig som med en högskole- eller civilingenjörsutbildning inom programmering/IT eller som via arbetslivserfarenhet har byggt kompetens inom DevOps.Du är bekant med moln och IT infrastruktur, verktyg som Docker, GIT, Puppet, Jenkins.Har du tidigare arbetat med AWS, Azure eller OpenStack är det extra meriterande.Som person är du lösningsorienterad och tekniskt intresserad.Du är ansvarstagande och noggrann, trivs med att ta egna initiativ och arbetar lika bra självständigt som i ett team.       Svenska och engelska flytande i tal och skrift är ett krav för tjänsten.      OM STUDENTWORK      Studentwork är ett av Nordens ledande konsult- och rekryteringsföretag specialiserade på studenter och examinerade kandidater med upp till fem års arbetslivserfarenhet.       Vi erbjuder främst tjänster inom ekonomi, försäljning, marknadsföring, teknik och administration.Vi är experter på att matcha våra kunders behov med kandidaternas egenskaper och kompetens.Hos oss kommer kulturen först och vår verksamhet styrs av våra värderingar: Always Deliver, Be Creative, Take Responsibility och Share Fun.         Mer information

headline: DEVOPS ENGINEER
description.text: The team supports the new games studio in our collaborative studio mission to create and launch the next billion dollar franchise.The team collaborates with game teams as well as shared tech teams in order to create and maintain the tech that enables the future of mobile game development.      As our DevOps Engineer, you will be a part of a team with a mission to build and maintain technology to support the studio in creating our new franchises.This includes evaluating existing tech, developing new creative solutions for our build pipeline, investigating problems reported by the game teams and coaching our game teams.You will work in close collaboration with our game teams and enjoy a creative, challenging and collaborative workplace where your ideas will be every bit as valued as your DevOps expertise.      You will work in a dynamic environment where work is driven by the requirements of the game teams which might include adapting to studio portfolio changes.Therefore you should be a fast learner with a positive attitude and a strong passion for working with new technology.You're excited about doing what's best for the games and adaptable enough to work on different things day to day based on their needs      Kompetenskrav   You have a great passion for DevOps engineering, new technologies, large scale systems and games.You’re an excellent communicator, happy dealing with people from different business units and with varying degrees of technical savviness.Therefore, you’re able to translate business needs to technical requirements and implementation.      Experience with the Unity build system      CI/CD build tools like Jenkins      Task & build automation tools like Gradle      Repo systems like Artifactory, NPM, Verdaccio      Improving team workflows via automation (Probot, Github and Slack integrations, notifications and alerts)      The mindset of writing tests along with the application code of projects, building up a healthy test coverage      Experience with Splunk      Experience with Kubernetes, Helm and Docker      Experience with various dynamic & static languages.Groovy, Python, Bash, TypeScript, C#      Collaborating with our dedicated ops team, client developers and other backend developers in various locations      Android & iOS app integration and delivery      Önskvärd kompetens   Unity Game development knowledge.      Asset Caching integration & strategies      Client development experience.      Familiarity with web protocols, application servers and web servers.      Knowledge about modern deterministic build systems such as Google Bazel

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text: Nordax is looking for a talented DevOps Engineer who wants to take up a challenge to create the best digital banking experience for our customers.   Nordax is one of the leading niche digital banks in Northern Europe that helps people make informed financial decisions for their well-being.Nordax has more than 190,000 customers and 230 employees, and act as a complement to main street banks.We are proud of our sound and data-driven competency that allows us to lend responsibly and earn our customers’ trust based on transparent and clear pricing models.We concentrate on a few products that we are experts in such as mortgages, equity release products, savings accounts, and private loans.   Have you seen our commercial “Bålan för Vanlight Folk (Mortgage for ordinary people)!” that humorously illustrates our mission?   <iframe width="560" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/CLxP3KML1rY" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>   Your mission   In an effort of Nordax to serve for “ordinary people” through our niche financial solutions, you will be a part of our IT team that builds and runs the heart of Nordax.As a member of the Platform team under the Development Unit of the IT Department, you will be responsible for building an even more modern DevOps infrastructure.You will let yourself shine with your innovative solutions while working in a team and report directly to the Head of Development.   Key responsibilities will include:   • designing and nurturing a brand-new DevOps platform   • implementing new CI/CD solutions through modern technologies such as Kubernetes   You must be confident in:   • Linux   • implementing CI/CD pipelines (with e.g.Jenkins, TFS, CircleCI, Octopus or similar tools)   • implementing server orchestration tools (Kubernetes)   • deploying containers (Docker)   • programming in C# or similar language (or your will to learn C#)   • version control system using git   Big pluses if you have experience in:   • working with one of the major cloud providers (e.g.Google Cloud, AWS, Azure)   • programming with .NET   • IT security   • working on monitoring and logging solutions   • taking a system administrator or similar role in IT operations   • working in the financial industry (e.g.understanding of control and regulatory perspective in change and release processes)   Why choose Nordax?   Nordax is a young and ambitious specialist bank, which means you will get lots of invaluable chances to grow personally as an IT expert through our cutting-edge technologies in a modern work environment.You will have a large space to be creative in building up new IT platforms and cultures.With highly-skilled developers as colleagues, while all working under the same roof in Stockholm city, you will gain a lot of opportunities to learn and grow together.   No matter how much we like our job, we believe it is important to have free time to recharge.Therefore, we provide generous benefits for your healthy work-life-balance.At Nordax we continuously work with corporate health and offer solutions that enhance our employees’ well-being and performance.   <iframe width="560" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/zcDD9Z0qSfs" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>   If you want to know more   We will review applications continuously and the position may be filled before the application deadline, so make sure not to wait until the last day!The applications shall include a short letter of interest and a CV, both written in English or Swedish.Applications are welcome by clicking the button below.Due to GDPR, we are unable to handle applications sent to us by email.   We are looking forward to receiving your application!

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text: About the company:   Paf is a Nordic gaming company founded on Åland in 1966 to generate profit for the benefit of society.We were one of the very first gaming companies to go online in 1999.Many of our games are exclusive to Paf and developed by our in-house Games Studio.We are an award-winning industry leader in responsible gaming.Our physical gaming operations include over 30 cruise ships criss-crossing the Baltic and North Seas.Paf has roughly 400 employees representing over 30 nationalities.Our offices are located on Åland, in Helsinki, Stockholm, Riga, Tallinn, Oslo, Norrköping and Madrid.Paf (Ålands Penningautomatförening) is licensed and controlled by the Government of Åland.In 2018, the Paf Group had a total turnover of 111.8 million euros and a profit of 24.6 million euros.More information at aboutpaf.com      About the job:   The Paf System Operations Team is now looking for a DevOps Engineer for our Mariehamn Office to manage both physical and cloud-based services.As a DevOps Engineer you will be acting as a key individual working with the latest technologies, supporting both in-house and cloud-based services and infrastructure.      You will be working closely with development teams, supporting them in their day-to-day work and be a part of our 24/7 OnCall Team.If you have a background as a developer/software engineer and want to change track and apply your coding skills to manage infrastructure and automation, then you might be the person we are looking for.      What's in it for you?   - Working in a highly professional team   - Opportunity for personal growth and training   - Working with the latest technologies and tools the market has to offer      What skills are needed?   Key-Skills:   - Developer background and knowledge   - AWS Services Knowledge   - AWS Infrastructure   - Experience in IaC, preferably Terraform   - Following Security Best Practices   - Fluent in English      Nice To Have Skills:   - Virtualization knowledge   - Physical Network setup   - Firewall and LoadBalancer Management   - Working with Web Application Firewall and CDN   - Project Management      Software Stack:   - Oracle & PostgreSQL Databases Inhouse   - AWS ECS Fargate   - AWS RDS Aurora, DynamoDB   - AWS VPC, ELB, EC2   - AWS Lambda   - Jenkins and GitHub   - Kafka Data Pipelines   - Containers and Microservice Architecture      Personality:   - Ability to work reaching out across functional borders   - Goal-oriented with the ability to keep focus   - Structured and organized   - Curious and eager to learn new things   - Good communication and collaboration skills      We kindly decline any contact from staffing/recruitment agencies.

headline: DEVOPS ENGINEER
description.text: We are EAAnd we make games – how cool is that?In fact, we entertain millions of people across the globe with the most amazing and immersive interactive software in the industry.But making games is hard work.That’s why we employ the most creative, passionate people in the industry. What a Site Reliability System Engineer does at EA:Modern video games rely on many different services behind the scenes.From matchmaking, marketplace, social features, anti-cheat detection, leaderboards, and server-side physics calculations.This ever-changing and ever-growing ecosystem exposes new operational challenges with every new game launch.The Site Reliability System Engineer works as part of a team responsible for the design of the system architecture, server infrastructure management and advanced technical support.She/he also provides technical expertise required to effectively deliver high-quality, timely IT solutions and services that meet EA’s business needs.The role is a part of a high performing team in a fast-paced organization, requiring partner and business focus.As well as demonstrated skills tied to leadership, people, communication, analytics and adaptability. Key Responsibilities: Provides effective solutions to the most complex operations engineering problemsInfluences design and technology choicesOperate with complex reporting relationships to reconcile competing priorities and achieve business unit objectivesCommunicates well via documentation and verbally with both peers and partnersCollaborates with peers across functions to help deliver highly reliable, scalable, and operable solutionsPartners with development teams, DBAs and QA in a DevOps model of agile development processImplements built, bought, or partner technology solutionsRapidly adapt to new and changing situations to quickly solve problems and find new directionsOperates continuous improvement through a change management methodologyPeriodic rotational 24 hours on call support  The next greatSite Reliability System Engineer also needs:Experience operating highly available solutions at scale with security and performanceExperience with automation and configuration management tools (Preferred: Chef and/or Puppet)Experience with public cloud services and deployment (Preferred: AWS, GCP, or Azure experience)Experience in programming/scripting languages (Preferred: Go, Python, and/or Ruby)Knowledge of the software development lifecycle and experience with source code management toolsAbility to troubleshoot complex issues ranging from system resources to application stack tracesHands-on experience in maintaining infrastructure for microservicesExperience with Continuous Integration, continuous delivery/deployment tools like Jenkins, Bamboo, or similarStrong knowledge of LinuxExperience integrating Open Source tools and softwareExperience with TCP/IP, routing, VLANS, AWS Direct Connect, DNS, VPN and other networking conceptsConceptual knowledge of Kubernetes, VMWare, Vagrant, Docker, or RocketExperience with monitoring services using tools like Grafana, Datadog, NewRelic, Zabbix, Nagios or similar.Ability to identify and resolve performance bottlenecks in highly complex systems and drive performance optimizationsWorking knowledge of enterprise storage technologies and protocols such as NFS, CIFS, iSCSI, Software Defined Storage, Object StorageOBSESSIVE desire to automate and improve everything including process improvements, standardizing tools and technologies!  Required Soft Skills:Peer and partner relationship focusedAbility to thrive in a fast-paced team environmentAbility to learn new skills/technologies quickly and independentlyStrong interpersonal and communication skillsAbility to work in a global organizationIndependent problem-solving skills…and, in general, the potential to sweep us off our feet!What’s in it for you?At EA we take care of our staff and have done so during our steady growth over the last decade.In addition to a competitive compensation package we offer our employees 10 EA games per year, massage every three weeks, a variety of sports activities (yoga, badminton and cross fit to name a few) and health care allowance.We have a collective bargain agreement with Unionen and Sveriges Ingenjörer and also provide our employees’ with occupational pension. Although we enjoy working hard at EA, we respect and value our employees’ personal lives.A good work-life balance is something we practice and maintain even during high-intensity periods. We look forward to receiving your application!

headline: Devops Engineer
description.text: Vårt erbjudande      ELITS kan erbjuda dig en trygg anställning, ett omväxlande arbete som konsult med stora utvecklingsmöjligheter.Vi har intressanta, längre uppdrag där du kan utvecklas och jobba nära kollegor som delar din passion för teknik och att leverera Another kind of IT.      Som anställd hos ELITS får du ta del av ett antal förmåner så som:      - Möjlighet till delägarskap och vinstdelning   - Friskvårdsbidrag   - Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring   - Privat pensionsrådgivning   - Individuellt anpassad utvecklings och utbildningsplan               Om rollen:      I rollen kommer du bli en del av vår kunds befintliga Linux-team bestående av andra duktiga tekniker och specialister.Miljön är en stor global IT-miljö och rollen innefattar dagliga arbetsuppgifter så som felsökning, drift/underhåll, installationer & konfigurering.Arbetet sker agilt och inom rollen kommer du även att arbeta med att stötta och supporta vår kunds utvecklingsteam.      Utvecklingsprojekt förekommer vanligen där du får bidra med idéer, lösningsförslag, test och utvärdering av nya teknologier.      I rollen som konsult finns stora utvecklingsmöjligheter för dig som brinner för teknik, Linux och opensource!            Vi ser att du du bör ha följande kunskaper:      - Högskole/KY-utbildning inom området eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet   - Ett par års arbetslivserfarenhet av Linuxbaserade operativsystem, gärna RHEL och CentOS   - Goda scriptkunskaper i Bash eller Python   - Automatisering i exempelvis Puppet, Salt eller Ansible   - Vana av att dokumentera på svenska och engelska         Meriterande om du även har erfarenhet inom ett eller flera av följande områden:      - Git   - Jenkins   - Docker   - Kubernetes   - Network   - Storage   - Jira   - Confluence   - MariaDB, Oracle               För att trivas i rollen som konsult bör du ha lätt för att skapa relationer, kunna arbeta både i team och självständigt samt ha ett stort personligt driv och lösningsfokus.      För denna tjänst genomförs bakgrundskontroll av slutkandidat.      Har du har frågor om rollen eller våra uppdrag, tveka inte att ta kontakt på det sätt som passar dig bäst, chat, mejl eller telefon!

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text: We now expand our Devops team with 6 new colleagues!      The team's responsibility will be to create and expand a new operating environment for one of our key customers within the Telecom industry.The environment is completely Opensource based, built on Openstack, Docker and Kubernetes, amongst other technologies.The purpose is for our customer to migrate services and applications when the environment is operational to replace existing legacy systems.      In this role you will have an active role in implementation and deployment, performing installations and configurations to get the environment up-and-running and service ready.      The team will work agile with daily stand-ups with the team's scrum-masters and weekly project meetings.      The location of work out in teams from one of our offices in Stockholm, Linköping or Gothenburg.            We are looking for you who have:      - Experience from IT-operations, preferably in a Linux environment   - Experience implementing and working with Docker & Kubernetes   - Coding, scripting skills (e.g, Bash, Python)   - Automation experience (Ansible or similar)   - Forward thinking and open mindset   - Understanding of agile principles         Nice-to-haves:      - Openstack experience   - Git   - Jira & Confluence   - Prometheus   - Nginx   - Keycloak   - CEPH   - ISPIO         Above is technologies that you will get to work with within the role and the project.            To fit the team and the role, we believe you are:      - A great problem solver and ability to deal with technical challenges   - A team player that contributes to a good atmosphere and, knowledge sharing and work environment.   - Someone who wants to work with modern technologies and strive for new learnings   - Want to have influence over technology choices and architecture               Fluent English in spoken and written terms are a requirement along with mandatory background check.            Our offering      ELITS can offer you a varied job as a consultant.We have interesting, long-term assignments where you can develop and work close to colleagues who share your passion for technology and to deliver Another Kind of IT.      As a ELITS employee, you will receive a range of benefits such as the opportunity for profit sharing, partnership, healthcare and massage grants, private health insurance, private pension advicing and an individual development plan.            The selection process is ongoing, so submit your application today!      If you have any questions, do not hesitate to contact the way that suits you best, chat, email or phone!

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text: Are you a DevOps Engineer that loves skill-sharing and pair-programming?Great, then we would get along really good!Were looking for a new colleague to join our TOC Engineering team.If this is your call – send us your application today!   THE POSITION   You will join an on-site team of four called TOC (Technical Operations Center) Engineering and work in an agile and QA-conscious tech organisation with high demands on reliability.Your main task will be building solutions that help reduce incident resolution time as well as proactively prevent them across the platform.This includes everything from automating monitoring and alarms on an infrastructural level, to teaching developers how to instrument and monitor their services.   Besides software design and development, you will play a great part in the teams architectural decisions and make sure that these align with the rest of the platform and infrastructure.Your technical decisions and corresponding implementation of solutions will help NENT to bridge the gap between cloud platform, operations and development.In other words, if you are all about service reliability and high availability – we have an offer you cannot refuse!   THE CHALLENGE AHEAD   The TOC Engineering team plays a key role in the organisation, making everyday life easier for customer service, operations agents and developers by automating manual processes and designing necessary tooling.You will be a valued member of an autonomous team and work within an expanding organization that strives for excellence by taking responsibility and pitch in where needed.    BE:   • Partner with engineering teams to help them instrument and monitor their services.   • Optimise and scale monitoring systems, alarms and dashboards.   • Discover new ways of gathering and using data from the services in order to see issues and prevent them from happening.   WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR   We believe you are currently working as a Cloud Developer, DevOps Engineer or Site Reliability Engineer with relevant experience.You are a problem solver at heart with an active interest in tech evangelism and quick to find solutions.You thrive in a team environment and collaborating on solutions.We also believe that you are a communicative individual that thrives in a context where knowledge-sharing is the key to success.   :   • Experience working with logs and metric systems, preferably Prometheus, Grafana and ELK.   • Good understanding of cloud infrastructure, preferably AWS.   • Practical, proven knowledge of shell scripting and at least one higher-level language, preferable Python and Go.   • Expert level understanding Linux servers.   • Experience with source code and binary repositories, build tools and pipelines such as Git, Jenkins, CI/CD and Artifactory.   • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.   • Ability of sharing knowledge and experience to others.    FROM THE REST:   • Experience of SRE (Site Reliability Engineering).   • Knowledge in JavaScript (Node, Angular, Vue, React) and HTML/CSS.   • Knowledge about writing automated test suites.   WE WANT TO HEAR FROM YOU   Our HQ is in Stockholm, but our market is the Nordics.You will become part of an amazing company with great people, content and culture.If this feels like your kind of challenge, please apply and attach your CV or LinkedIn profile.This is an ongoing recruitment and the position might be filled before the last apply date.   NOT IN SWEDEN YET?NO PROBLEM!WE OFFER RELOCATION SERVICES.      WHILE WE ARE TAKING SOME TIME OFF, THE FEEDBACK ON YOUR APPLICATION MAY TAKE A LITTLE BIT LONGER.HAPPY HOLIDAYS!   Nordic Entertainment Group AB (publ.)(NENT Group) is committed to equality and diversity and we welcome applications from all qualified individuals regardless of ethnicity, religion, age, gender, sexual orientation, disability, and marital status.We want to make sure your recruitment experience is the best it can be – so, if youre selected for an interview, please let us know if there are any adjustments we can make that would be helpful for you.   NENT Group is the Nordic regions leading entertainment provider.We entertain millions of people every day with our streaming services, TV channels and radio stations, and our production companies create content that is experienced around the world.We make life more entertaining by telling stories, touching lives and expanding worlds – from live sports, movies and series to music and original shows.Headquartered in Stockholm, NENT Group is listed on Nasdaq Stockholm (NENT A and NENT B).
