headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text: Company Description   Snow Software is the global leader in technology intelligence solutions, ensuring the trillions spent on all forms of technology is optimized to drive maximum value.More than 4,000 organizations around the world rely on Snow's platform to provide complete visibility, optimize usage and spend, and minimize regulatory risk.Headquartered in Stockholm, Snow has more local offices and regional support centers than any other software asset and cloud management provider, delivering unparalleled results to our customers and partners.   Job Description   We are looking for another DevOps Engineer to expand our team, that has solid experience of making development teams efficient by driving good practices and behaviors, and with the use of continuous Integration, virtualization and automation frameworks.    As a DevOps engineer at Snow, you will   Work closely integrated with the product teams to optimize and automate delivery pipelines, but also improve practicesWork with and understand team needs to optimize feedback loops for efficient improvement of our automation Work with development in the DevOps team; creating re-usable solutions to help automate environment deployments supporting our CI and CD flowsBeing a part of driving the DevOps culture, promoting, improving how our development teams work with automation of quality and delivery   Qualifications   We believe that you thrive in a team setting and have a solid understanding of modern development practices and tools.You also have some hands-on experience with development using either PowerShell, C#, or Java.But most importantly, you are always looking for opportunities to further develop your skills, and new ways how to make development teams efficient.   To be successful in this role, you have   Built and set up CI and CD pipelines, optimizing efficiency and qualityUnderstood modern development practices, and experience from an agile organizationGood knowledge on how to implement automation, using PowerShellKnowledge about infrastructure as code such as Ansible, Chef or PuppetVersion control experience with git.Virtualization technology experience such as VMWare vSphere or Microsoft Hyper-VPreviously worked with Linux and Unix systemsAgile methodologies and practices, such as Scrum, Kanban, XP, Lean    Also, we see it as beneficial if you have experience in any of the following areas   Cloud infrastructure solutions such as Azure or Amazon AWSAutomated quality and test automationProgramming using C#, Java and or PythonTeamCity and Docker experience.   Additional information   This is a chance for you succeed in an environment where you will have the possibility to make a daily impact.Every day you will get to work alongside helpful and down-to-earth colleagues who are dedicated and ambitious.We fully recognize that it is our employees that make Snow a success and the global leader in the development and delivery of dedicated SAM solutions.If you are the right person for the role, we will offer you exciting and developing assignments and you will get to be part of a fantastic journey within a dynamic high-growth business.   We look forward to your application.

description.text: Smart Refill provides platforms and engaging apps for banks, fintechs and telecom operators.We specialize in secure payment and information solutions that simplify the everyday life of the users and boost the businesses of our customers - Handelsbanken, Resurs Bank, Telia Company and Telenor are some examples.We are a licensed E-money Institution and our PCI DSS Level 1 compliant environment handles hundreds of millions of SEK in payment transactions every year.Our mobile applications are praised for being well-designed, innovative and useful.      We are looking for a DevOps engineer to join our team.Your mission will be to act as a bridge between IT operations and the developer teams, making sure that the building, launching and maintenance of our mobile apps run smoothly.      About you      - You have a background as a developer and/or system administrator   - You have a couple of years relevant DevOps experience   - You have worked with CI/CD   - You’re well-versed in Linux and MariaDB   - You have worked with build servers, such as GitLab or Jenkins   - You’re familiar with automation and containers, i.e.Ansible, Kubernetes, Docker   - You will occasionally perform work during nightly service windows   - You enjoy working in teams and are happy to help others, but also ask for help when needed      Nice-to-haves      - Virtualisation, i.e.Vmware   - Monitoring systems and alerts, ie.OP5   - Atlassian Suite   - Network   - PCI DSS compliant environments   - tomcat, Nginx, Docker/Containers, Veeam Backup & Replication, Git, PAM, OpenLDAP      About our place      At our office in central Helsingborg, you get a bunch of awesome colleagues, a dynamic workplace and great benefits - with an ocean view.We are really proud of our product, culture and inclusive atmosphere.Teamwork, innovation, quality and passion are our guiding values. headline: DevOps Testingenjör
description.text: About Axis Communications   Axis enables a smarter and safer world by creating network solutions that provide insights for improving security and new ways of doing business.As the industry leader in network video, Axis offers products and services for video surveillance and analytics, access control, and audio systems.Axis has more than 3,000 dedicated employees in over 50 countries and collaborates with partners worldwide to deliver customer solutions.      For more information about Axis, please visit our website www.axis.com .   Referensnummer: 2895   Axis befinner sig i en framtidsbransch där vi är världsledande.Det innebär att som testingenjör här har du inte bara en viktig roll i utvecklingen av Axis produkter och lösningar utan du får också vara med och påverka branschen i sin helhet.   Vi på Small Solution Test arbetar tätt tillsammans med utvecklarteam för att ta fram end-to-end lösningar som knyter ihop slutanvändare med vårt växande utbud av kameror och annan hårdvara.I vårt team är du med och utvecklar Windows applikationer, diverse molntjänster och mobilapplikationer för att paketera hela lösningar.Detta ställer höga krav på samarbetsformer, med tvärfunktionella och agila team som tar fram en helhet för slutanvändarna.   Nu söker vi en passionerad testingenjör som brinner för DevOps och älskar ett varierat arbete som sträcker sig över stora delar av teknikstacken.Som testingenjör arbetar du i agila team som kontinuerligt utvecklar, testar och levererar nya funktioner till produktionsmiljön.Du kommer ansvara för att planera, leda och driva teststrategin som innefattar såväl automatiska tester som manuella systemtester samt kontinuerligt förbättra verktygskedjan för CI/CD.I arbetet ingår också att analysera användarbeteende och jobba tätt ihop med våra slutkunder för att lära oss mer om hur våra produkter och lösningar uppfattas.   VEM ÄR DU?   Vi tror att du vill nå framgång med andra, drivs av utmaningar, samt brinner för kvalitet och god användarupplevelse i alla sammanhang.Du är driven, nyfiken, genuint intresserad av teknik och gillar att dela med dig av din kunskap till andra.   Du har en relevant teknisk ingenjörsutbildning på civil – eller högskolenivå som innefattar programmering och nätverkskommunikation.Vi ser gärna att du har tidigare erfarenhet av mjukvarutestning och/eller utveckling och har kunskap om agila arbetsmetoder.Du är väl förtrogen med olika testtekniker som riskbaserad, explorativ och automatiserad testning samt verktyg för CI/CD.   Det är meriterande, men inget krav, om du har kunskap och erfarenhet inom något av följande:   Skriptspråk, såsom Python eller JavaScript   CI verktyg, såsom GitLab, TeamCity eller Jenkins   C# .NET-teknologi   Molnmiljöer, såsom AWS eller Azure   VAD KAN AXIS ERBJUDA DIG?   Hos oss får du arbeta med kollegor med kompetens från olika delar av organisationen, vilket är berikande och underlättar kompetensspridning.Det finns också stora möjligheter till kompetensutveckling och att utvecklas åt det håll man själv är intresserad av.Vi tycker att god kundkännedom är viktigt och därför har vi ett antal initiativ där vi låter ingenjörer jobba nära några slutkunder som vi jobbar tätt ihop med för att lära oss mer om hur våra produkter uppfattas.   Som företag förväntar vi oss ett stort engagemang av våra medarbetare men inte på bekostnad av privatlivet.En god balans mellan arbete och privatliv tror vi gynnar både företag och individ.   Axis som företag tror på en diversifierad arbetsstyrka.Vi vet att diversitet i grupper skapar förutsättningar för en mer kreativ arbetsmiljö, vilket är en grund för att vi ska lyckas.   LÅTER DET INTRESSANT?   Tveka då inte att skicka in din ansökan redan idag.

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
About Etraveli Group
Etraveli Group is one of the leading flight-centric online travel agencies (OTA) in the world. Expertise in travel e-commerce and economies of scale together with an impressive proprietary IT platform gives us a scalable and profitable business model.

Your day
Together with a skilled set of DevOps Engineers, in a team located in both Gothenburg and Athens, Greece, you’ll be part of our journey moving into the next generation service platform that we’re currently developing.

We focus on a private cloud platform using OpenStack, but we also utilize public cloud solutions and as a DevOps Engineer at Etraveli Group AB we want you to be interested in cutting edge technologies.

About you
Maybe you have a Bachelor’s degree or you may be self-taught, it doesn’t matter - the most important thing is your passion towards devops and open-source technologies, and of course your attitude and “can do spirit”. 

As a person you have good communication skills and willing to take the initiative, you’ll be working closely with other teams developing and supporting new as well as existing solutions.

Our technology stack

- Service Discovery: Consul
- Container Orchestration: Kubernetes
- Linux: CentOS, Ubuntu
- Monitoring/Metrics/Logging: Icinga, Grafana, Prometheus, ELK/EFK
- Virtualization platforms: OpenStack, VMWare
- Automation/IaC: Ansible, Saltstack, Terraform
- Scripting: Bash, Go and Python

Qualifications for the position

- Experience with Kubernetes
- Experience with OpenStack
- Experience with Monitoring
- Experience with Ansible/Saltstack
- Experience with Git in a collaborative environment




- Experience with Network (A10, Arista and F5)
- Experience with databases
- Experience with Java and Tomcat

Our offer
We offer a flexible work schedule and work in a diverse environment with offices in both Sweden and Greece. 

We are located in the center of Gothenburg. Our office consists of a cheerful and open-minded group of around 70 people, all with different experiences and personalities. We believe that this is what makes us a good team, the ambition is common - we strive for the same goal, passionate about what we do and we work hard at a high pace.

We invest heavily in education and have everything from internal Open Source projects to book circles and self-study. We attend conferences, host meetups, either ourselves or with partners. We are active in a number of different communities such as Atlassian User Group and React JS.


Please send your CV and a cover letter by clicking "Apply For This Job".

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
We now expand our Devops team with 6 new colleagues!



In this role you will have an active role in implementation and deployment, performing installations and configurations to get the environment up-and-running and service ready.







We are looking for you who have:


- Experience implementing and working with Docker & Kubernetes
- Coding, scripting skills (e.g, Bash, Python)
- Automation experience (Ansible or similar)
- Forward thinking and open mindset
- Understanding of agile principles


Nice-to-haves:

- Openstack experience
- Git

- Prometheus
- Nginx
- Keycloak
- CEPH
- ISTIO


Above is technologies that you will get to work with within the role and the project.





- A great problem solver and ability to deal with technical challenges
- A team player that contributes to a good atmosphere and, knowledge sharing and work environment.
- Someone who wants to work with modern technologies and strive for new learnings
- Want to have influence over technology choices and architecture








Our offering

ELITS can offer you a varied job as a consultant. We have interesting, long-term assignments where you can develop and work close to colleagues who share your passion for technology and to deliver Another Kind of IT.

As a ELITS employee, you will receive a range of benefits such as the opportunity for profit sharing, partnership, healthcare and massage grants, private health insurance, private pension advicing and an individual development plan.





If you have any questions, do not hesitate to contact the way that suits you best, chat, email or phone!

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
WHY WE WILL LOVE YOU

We at Ingka Group believe you share the IKEA values and that you are passionate about our vision in becoming the world’s leading multichannel home furnishing retailer. We believe you have a great understanding of what simplicity and togetherness means. As a person you have the curiosity and clear understanding of how we would like to automate as well as integrate our deployment pipeline with a “getting things done” mentality. Together we will research, evaluate, develop and deploy new applications and work on ways to quickly identify and overcome any blockers we might encounter along the way.

You are driven by renewing and improving by continuously integrating and delivering in a fast-paced and challenging environment.

We believe you are experienced in:

Public clouds like GCP and Azure



Infrastructure automation using IaC

CI/CD



A DAY IN YOUR LIFE WITH US

We trust your knowledge and experience when it comes to DevOps ways of working, that’s why you will have the space to take responsibility for the tools and methods we use for our continuous delivery. We guide, advice and consult teams towards a modern, efficient & safe agile delivery model.

When you spot an opportunity to innovate, we at IKEA encourage you to do so. Feel free to test new solutions, creative suggestions or bringing aboard new technologies to boost the everyday life for all our co-workers and customers. And by working closely with your fellow engineers.

In our chapter we share our knowledge and coach each other when it comes to functional expertise. We will grow together towards a data-informed organisation by connecting across multiple initiatives within the Ingka Group.

TOGETHER AS A TEAM

We’re the ones who make it possible for people to have a smarter life at home and a hassle-free and rewarding shopping experience. Together we work to find new digital solutions for every business need to help make IKEA a great and efficient place to work. We like to think of ourselves as innovative and modern, and we believe that nothing would actually work without us.

As personal and professional growth is important, we encourage curiosity. Together we will discover new things, step into the unknown and make sure we are always trying out new ways.

QUESTIONS AND SUPPORT? LET'S CONNECT!

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
Qliro has a track record of delivering new products and services at unmatched speed. We are active in an exciting intersection of the e-commerce, payment and financial services markets. We target both leading online merchants and millions of Nordic consumers seeking superior digital payments and consumer finance products.

We are looking for a Developer Experience Engineer who is passionate about making work smooth and simple for our Engineering organization.

You will be part of a team working in close collaboration with our Engineering organization with the goal to make sure the value our teams are creating can be delivered to production as early and safely as possible. Together with your team, you are responsible for continuously figuring out what you can do to make the most impact towards this goal. 

At Qliro we want our Engineering teams to take full ownership of their products and to be able to deliver value safely and continuously. 

What you will do

· Inspire the teams with your passion for automation and continuous delivery

· Support the teams in designing systems that ensure safe and fast deliveries to production

You will work with tools such as:

· Linux, Ansible

· Docker SWARM

· HAProxy

· ELK

· Git, Octopus, Proget

Who are we looking for?

· As a person, we expect you to be enthusiastic, proactive and eager to share your expertise.



· Experience in automation using Ansible

· Experience with Docker Containerization

Perks

Qliro offers a dynamic and fast-paced Fintech environment with teams of driven and flexible individuals. We thrive on challenges, personal growth and you will be able to excel within the company. We have a learning and development focused environment with an emphasis on knowledge sharing and training. We work hard to create a workplace that is diverse and inclusive, where you can have a great work-life balance and love the work you do.

We’ll provide you with an attractive salary, pension and insurance plan along with 30 days’ annual leave. What more? At the office you can to enjoy our Thursday breakfast buffet together with all our amazing colleagues, regular mindfulness sessions and a sports hour every week.



WOW in everything we do

Our company was founded in 2014 and the team was given one task, bring a new payment solution to the market, in only 6 months.

Today we have grown to a team of over 200 people from over 30 different countries. We are an E-commerce business that expanded to consumer finance supplying costumers in all of the Nordics. We have launched a range of commercially successful products, including a pay-after-delivery product, an e-commerce checkout, D2C saving and loans products, apps, self-service website and merchant-facing interfaces.

Qliro offers a dynamic and fast-paced Fintech environment with teams of driven and flexible individuals. We thrive on challenges, personal growth and we have a learning and development focused environment that emphasis on knowledge sharing and training. We work hard to create a workplace which is diverse and inclusive, where you can have a great work-life balance and love the work you do.

Want to learn more about us as an employer please visit our career page.

headline: Devops Engineer
description.text:
Vårt erbjudande

ELITS kan erbjuda dig en trygg anställning, ett omväxlande arbete som konsult med stora utvecklingsmöjligheter. Vi har intressanta, längre uppdrag där du kan utvecklas och jobba nära kollegor som delar din passion för teknik och att leverera Another kind of IT.

Som anställd hos ELITS får du ta del av ett antal förmåner så som:

- Möjlighet till delägarskap och vinstdelning
- Friskvårdsbidrag
- Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring
- Privat pensionsrådgivning
- Individuellt anpassad utvecklings och utbildningsplan




Om rollen:

I rollen kommer du bli en del av vår kunds befintliga Linux-team bestående av andra duktiga tekniker och specialister. Miljön är en stor global IT-miljö och rollen innefattar dagliga arbetsuppgifter så som felsökning, drift/underhåll, installationer & konfigurering. Arbetet sker agilt och inom rollen kommer du även att arbeta med att stötta och supporta vår kunds utvecklingsteam.

Utvecklingsprojekt förekommer vanligen där du får bidra med idéer, lösningsförslag, test och utvärdering av nya teknologier.





Vi ser att du du bör ha följande kunskaper:

- Högskole/KY-utbildning inom området eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet
- Ett par års arbetslivserfarenhet av Linuxbaserade operativsystem, gärna RHEL och CentOS

- Automatisering i exempelvis Puppet, Salt eller Ansible
- Vana av att dokumentera på svenska och engelska


Meriterande om du även har erfarenhet inom ett eller flera av följande områden:

- Git

- Docker
- Kubernetes
- Network
- Storage

- Confluence
- MariaDB, Oracle




För att trivas i rollen som konsult bör du ha lätt för att skapa relationer, kunna arbeta både i team och självständigt samt ha ett stort personligt driv och lösningsfokus.

För denna tjänst genomförs bakgrundskontroll av slutkandidat.

Har du har frågor om rollen eller våra uppdrag, tveka inte att ta kontakt på det sätt som passar dig bäst, chat, mejl eller telefon!

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
Nordax is looking for a talented DevOps Engineer who wants to take up a challenge to create the best digital banking experience for our customers.

Nordax is one of the leading niche digital banks in Northern Europe that helps people make informed financial decisions for their well-being. Nordax has around 200,000 customers and 230 employees, and acts as an strong alternative of main street banks. We are proud of our sound and data-driven competency that allows us to lend responsibly and earn our customers’ trust based on transparent and clear pricing models. We concentrate on a few products that we are experts in such as mortgages, equity release products, savings accounts, and private loans.

Your mission

In an effort of Nordax to serve for “ordinary people” through our niche financial solutions, you will be a part of our IT team that builds and runs the heart of Nordax. As a member of the Platform team under the Development Unit of the IT Department, you will be responsible for building an even more modern DevOps infrastructure. You will let yourself shine with your innovative solutions while working in a team and report directly to the Head of Development.



- Designing and nurturing a brand-new DevOps platform
- Implementing new CI/CD solutions through modern technologies such as Kubernetes


You must be confident in:


- implementing CI/CD pipelines (with e.g. Jenkins, TFS, CircleCI, Octopus or similar tools)
- implementing server orchestration tools (Kubernetes)
- deploying containers (Docker)
- programming in C# or similar language (or your will to learn C#)
- version control system using git


Big pluses if you have experience in:

- working with one of the major cloud providers (e.g. Google Cloud, AWS, Azure)
- programming with .NET
- IT security
- working on monitoring and logging solutions
- taking a system administrator or similar role in IT operations
- working in the financial industry (e.g. understanding of control and regulatory perspective in change and release processes)


Why choose Nordax?

Nordax is a young and ambitious specialist bank, which means you will get lots of invaluable chances to grow personally as an IT expert through our cutting-edge technologies in a modern work environment. You will have a large space to be creative in building up new IT platforms and cultures. With highly-skilled developers as colleagues, while all working under the same roof in Stockholm city, you will gain a lot of opportunities to learn and grow together.

Therefore, we provide generous benefits for your healthy work-life-balance. At Nordax we continuously work with corporate health and offer solutions that enhance our employees’ well-being and performance. Watch 'A day in the life at Nordax Bank' below.

Next step

We will review applications continuously and the position may be filled before the application deadline, so make sure not to wait until the last day! 

We believe in evidence-based tests in order to eliminate unconscious bias and increase hiring precision - the right person for the right position. 

We look forward to your application!

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
Who are we?
Volvo Cars is a company on a mission; to bring traditional car manufacturing into a connected, sustainable and smart future.
Since 1927, we have been a brand known for our commitment to safety, creating innovative cars that make life less complicated for our consumers. In 2010, we decided to transform our business, resulting in a totally new generation of cars and technologies, as well as steady growth and record sales. 
We are constantly pushing our own skills and abilities to drive change in the automobile industry like never before. We are looking for innovative, committed people to join us in this endeavour and create safe, sustainable and connected cars. We believe in the power of people and will challenge and support you to reach your full potential. Join us and be part of Volvo Cars’ journey into the future.

What we offer
As a DevOps team member, you will develop an automated process for building and testing software which is constructed at Volvo Cars with model-based design and C/C++ code. This automated process handles all the required steps for creating and delivering a binary file ready to be downloaded to our cars.

You will be a part of a team responsible for deciding the future of our Software Factory with its CI/CD system to support hundreds of developers.

What you’ll do
As a DevOps engineer you are responsible for develop and maintain an automated process to assure software quality. You will maintain and update current scripts/tools to support an evolving software. You will evaluate and develop new tools to support developers.

Who are you
We think you have a Master of Science in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent and expertise working with C/C++ and Python. Experience working with continuous integration tools and an understanding of software development workflow and processes.

Meritorious:
• Zuul
• Experience in software development for embedded systems
• Git/Gerrit
• Ansible

• Docker

• Windows automation
• Matlab
• Understanding of model-based systems, Simulink/TargetLink
• Experience with issue tracking tool and an Agile way of working


We are looking for a person with good ability of communication and team work, that is essential. You are structured, with good analytical and problem-solving skills and capable of focusing on both daily issues and long term visions together with the interest in new tools and technologies.


Does this sound like an interesting challenge for you? We would love you to apply! 
Please note that applications via email will not be accepted.

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
Varnish Software is the company behind Varnish Cache, a widely recognized open-source HTTP proxy that significantly enhances web performance and enables digital content delivery. Varnish Cache has experienced a tremendous growth since its inception and currently powers more than 4.7 million websites globally.

Varnish Software is growing on a global market and is now entering a new phase where the Mainstream Enterprise Customers’ market will be addressed even stronger. 

We are seeking an experienced and hands-on DevOps engineer with a passion for Automation, Linux, Open Source, scalability and software infrastructure, to join our Tools and Platforms team in Karlstad.





This objective is achieved by developing easy-to-use administration tools, monitoring tools and working with cloud providers such as AWS, Google and Microsoft to make Varnish available and easy to use in their ecosystems.

They complete each other, and together they architect and build components that are well tested and compatible with modern hosting environments and deployment tools.



As a DevOps, you will strengthen our team working with our customers to install, configure, automate, monitor both customer infrastructure and our own infrastructure, this can range from a couple of servers to hundreds of servers.

We have a lot of interesting work ahead of us in expanding our Varnish offering, Varnish feature set and scaling to meet demand. We are passionate about Go and Python, clean APIs and have a bias towards shipping and believe that tests are key to higher velocity and reliability. If you share our passions then you’ll fit right in.

As part of the Tools and Platforms team, your primary responsibilities are to:

• Participating in the implementation of new system and infrastructure projects.
• Apply and adhere to good best practices within an agile/iterative development approach.
• Setup and monitor services, collect metrics and tune for performance.
• Work together with our partners with routines and documentation.

• CI/CD: Automated build, test, and deployment of applications and services
• Site Reliability: Design for operational quality, monitoring, and maintenance
• Monitoring and sanity checks of IT-services, using metrics to improve performance and quality.
• Contribute with experience to ensure that everything we build is compatible with modern environments and features specific to these such as auto-scaling, service discovery, and containerization.
• Be creative and brainstorm ideas for ways we can further streamline our development process.

You are:

• A Self-starter who can take work on an idea and quickly and iterate through feedback.
• Self-motivated and self-managing with strong organizational skills.
• Able to research best practices and create, validate and present your findings.
• Able to keep projects going from start to finish.

Relevant experience:

• Experience working with services from AWS, Azure or GCP or similar providers.

• Experience in designing and building systems that scale.

• Knowledge of automation platforms such as Ansible, Puppet, Chef or Terraform
• Security


What we offer

• Work in a modern IT environment on a global scale.
• Plenty of challenges and opportunities.
• Ability to influence product development, creating administration and analytics tools
• A happy, creative, non-hierarchical work environment in which you are a valued member of our organization
• Involvement in the complete lifecycle of software products
• Interaction and cooperation with top global customers
• An opportunity to showcase your work in community meetups and other conferences where applicable
• Contribute your expertise as part of the support rotation
• An international environment with offices and colleagues all over the world

Varnish Software is a laid-back place to work. But make no mistake: we do take very seriously the work of creating and sharing our software – and have fun doing it. We value flexibility, independence, and trust.

Seniority Level: Mid/Senior level
Industry: Information Technology & Services
Employment Type: Full-time

Välkommen med sin ansökan!

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
Join us on our journey towards developing tomorrow's technology!

DEK Technologies is a technical consultant company with a flat organization aiming to develop proactive and creative solutions. Our teams are self-managed and we strive to stay this way by using Agile working methods. At DEK Technologies you will find collaborative and empowered engineers with the ability to self-organize and create innovative solutions.

We are constantly growing and are now looking for experienced developers with a background in DevOps ready to join our DEK-family. As a DevOps engineer at DEK Technologies, you will be working inhouse as a part of a cross-functional team.

You are a team player with great communication skills who enjoys working together with your colleagues. Since we are a flat organization working according to Agile methods, we expect you to be self-motivated with the ability to organize your daily work.



- BS or MS in computer science, software engineering or similar, alternatively equal knowledge acquired through working experience
- At least 2 years of experience from working with DevOps

- Experience from implementing and maintaining CI/CD pipelines
- Experience in cloud environments



If you also have experience from Openstack, Container Orchestration or knowledge about telecom it is beneficial. If you are or have an interest in being, a certified Scrum-master this is also positive.

We can offer you an inspiring Agile environment with great possibilities where your personal development and growth are just as important as our business. At DEK Technologies we work in goal-oriented teams which are mostly placed in-house. You will work alongside your development team but there’s also a possibility for you to go work abroad. We offer all our employees creative time where you are given the opportunity to use 10 % of your time to expand your knowledge and continue to develop through self-controlled projects.

Together we develop tomorrow’s technology.

headline: Forskningsingenjör DevOps
description.text:
KTH är ett av Europas ledande tekniska universitet och en viktig arena för kunskapsutveckling. Som Sveriges största universitet för teknisk forskning och utbildning samlar vi studenter, forskare och fakultet från hela världen. Vår forskning och utbildning omfattar såväl naturvetenskap som alla grenar inom teknik samt arkitektur, industriell ekonomi, samhällsplanering, historia och filosofi.




Arbetsuppgifter

Vi söker en programutvecklare på deltid som kommer att arbeta med gränssnittet i vår forskning och industriella aktiviteter för visualiseringsverktyg för DevOps.

I synnerhet är positionen inriktad på utveckling av metoder för datainsamling och metoder för att övervaka och visualisera kontinuerlig integration av DevOps-miljöer. I detta sammanhang, och beroende på DevOps affärsanvändningsfall från våra industripartners, kommer nyckelprestationsindikatorer (KPI) att identifieras och utvärderas. Verktygsprototyper kommer att implementeras för att samla dessa KPI: er från heterogena datalagrar, i syfte att analysera och visa dem via anpassade instrumentpaneler till slutanvändarna. Vi är intresserade av att utveckla interaktiva webbaserade instrumentpaneler i syfte att hjälpa olika DevOps-intressenter i kvalitetsåtgärder.


Arbetsuppgifterna är relaterade till ett forskningstema på enheten för Mekatronik vid KTH fokuserar på livscykel-interoperabilitet av ingenjörsmässiga data och verktyg, exempelvis relaterade till Dev-Ops-principer. Syftet är att utveckla system i gränslandet mellan maskinteknik, inbyggda system och mjukvaruteknik. 

Kvalifikationer

För att kvalificera dig till anställningen har du en civilingenjörsutbildning inom mekatronik, cyber-fysiska system eller mjukvarututveckling.

Vi ser det som meriterande med utbildning i web och moln-tekniker, erfarenhet från mjukvarutveckling, produktutveckling och erfarenhet av agila arbetsprocesser. Det är även meriterande om du har erfarenhet från industriell mjukvarututveckling i större skala.

Vi kommer lägga stor vikt vid personlig lämplighet som:

• Färdigheter i att agera självständigt
• Färdigheter i att skriva och tala engelska

Fackliga representanter




Ansökan

Du ansöker via KTH:s rekryteringssystem. Du som sökande har huvudansvaret för att din ansökan är komplett när den skickas in. Din kompletta ansökan ska vara KTH tillhanda senast sista dagen för ansökningsperioden.

 Tidsbegränsad anställning till och med 2022-03-01, med tillträde enligt överenskommelse.

Övrigt

Jämställdhet, mångfald och avståndstagande från alla former av diskriminering är både en kvalitetsfråga och en självklar del av KTH:s värdegrund.



Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt försäljare av platsannonser.

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
Kindred is one of the fastest growing online gaming operators in Europe with industry leading Sportsbook, Casino and Games, Poker and Bingo products via desktop, tablet and mobile. Our brand promise is built on the motto "By Players, For Players" putting customers at the centre of our business!

We are looking for someone passionate about automation and Continuous Delivery to join our strong team based in Stockholm.

At Kindred we practice Continuous Delivery all the way, very few tasks are not automated. We constantly improve the system to make it faster, better and to support new frameworks and technologies.

As an Engineer working in our DevOps culture you will provide technical consultancy to support the various teams which deliver the products which enhance customer experience and business value. 

You will research, design, develop and enhance all aspects of our Continuous Delivery system and the infrastructure around it. You are passionate about new technology, automation and the DevOps culture and how this can be turned into business values. A background in operations as well as in development or test automation is a plus.



-Design and implement automation tools from concept to production.

-Help product development teams troubleshoot problems, identifying and implementing solutions.

-Be an ambassador for DevOps and Continuous Delivery principles

We're looking for someone with the following skills, knowledge and experience

-Development in either Python or Java

-Build and CI tools like Jenkins, Thoughtworks Go and Maven

-Be comfortable using CM tools like Puppet, Ansible, Chef

-Best Practices and IT operations in an always-up, always available environment

-Experience with a wide variety of Open Source Technology

-AWS

headline: Devops Engineer
description.text:
Vårt erbjudande

ELITS kan erbjuda dig en trygg anställning, ett omväxlande arbete som konsult med stora utvecklingsmöjligheter. Vi har intressanta, längre uppdrag där du kan utvecklas och jobba nära kollegor som delar din passion för teknik och att leverera Another kind of IT.

Som anställd hos ELITS får du ta del av ett antal förmåner så som:

- Möjlighet till delägarskap och vinstdelning
- Friskvårdsbidrag
- Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring
- Privat pensionsrådgivning
- Individuellt anpassad utvecklings och utbildningsplan




Om rollen:

I rollen kommer du bli en del av vår kunds befintliga Linux-team bestående av andra duktiga tekniker och specialister. Miljön är en stor global IT-miljö och rollen innefattar dagliga arbetsuppgifter så som felsökning, drift/underhåll, installationer & konfigurering. Arbetet sker agilt och inom rollen kommer du även att arbeta med att stötta och supporta vår kunds utvecklingsteam.

Utvecklingsprojekt förekommer vanligen där du får bidra med idéer, lösningsförslag, test och utvärdering av nya teknologier.





Vi ser att du du bör ha följande kunskaper:

- Högskole/KY-utbildning inom området eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet
- Ett par års arbetslivserfarenhet av Linuxbaserade operativsystem, gärna RHEL och CentOS

- Automatisering i exempelvis Puppet, Salt eller Ansible
- Vana av att dokumentera på svenska och engelska


Meriterande om du även har erfarenhet inom ett eller flera av följande områden:

- Git

- Docker
- Kubernetes
- Network
- Storage

- Confluence
- MariaDB, Oracle




För att trivas i rollen som konsult bör du ha lätt för att skapa relationer, kunna arbeta både i team och självständigt samt ha ett stort personligt driv och lösningsfokus.

För denna tjänst genomförs bakgrundskontroll av slutkandidat.

Har du har frågor om rollen eller våra uppdrag, tveka inte att ta kontakt på det sätt som passar dig bäst, chat, mejl eller telefon!

headline: DevOps ingenjör
description.text:
Scania genomgår nu en transformation från att vara en leverantör av lastbilar, bussar och motorer till en leverantör av kompletta och hållbara transportlösningar.

Varje dag är drygt 15 000 tekniker världen över beroende av Scanias servicesystem för att kunna utföra underhåll, felsökning, reparationer, ECU-uppdateringar och ombyggnationer på våra kunders fordon och motorer. Avdelningen Vehicle Service Information är ansvariga för utveckling av detta systemstöd.

Till gruppen System Coordination and Development (YSPC) behöver vi utöka med en ny lagspelare i teamet som ansvarar för Configuration Management (CM), verifiering, monitorering och systemägarskap för verktyget SDP3 och dess molnbaserade ersättare SWS och vi tror att du är rätt person för det jobbet!

I denna roll ingår du i ett team med systemägare, testledare, fälttestkoordinator och CM. Ni ansvarar tillsammans för planering, taktning, konfigurering och release. Du kommer även jobba i tätt samarbete med produktägare, arkitekter och utvecklargrupper.

Dina arbetsuppgifter
Som DevOps ingenjör på YSPC kommer du mötas av en mängd olika typer av utmaningar, du kommer behöva samarbeta med utvecklarteam och med dina egna teammedlemmar för att lösa dessa. Stor vikt läggs därför på samarbetsförmåga såväl som analytisk problemlösningsförmåga.

Exempel på typiska arbetsuppgifter är:


• Uppdatera och förbättra processer för byggkedjan (CI/CD) av våra produkter SDP3 och SWS
• Sätta upp och ansvara för monitorering av våra tjänster och produkter
• Underhålla och förbättra bygg-, import- och konsistenskontroll-skript för våra produkter SDP3 och SWS

Din profil
Vi söker dig som är:


• utbildad inom systemvetenskap med relevant universitetsexamen
• har relevant erfarenhet av DevOps baserad utveckling
• kunskap och erfarenhet inom system för versionshantering och monitorering
• en kommunikativ teamspelare som kan samarbeta med olika sorters människor.
• strukturerad och kan följa tidplaner och tagna beslut.

För mer information


Ansökan
Din ansökan ska innehålla personligt brev, CV och relevanta betygskopior.


Scania är en världsledande leverantör av transportlösningar. Tillsammans med våra partners och kunder leder vi övergången till ett hållbart transportsystem. Under 2018 levererade vi 88 000 lastbilar, 8 500 bussar samt 12 800 industri- och marinmotorer till våra kunder. Vi omsatte över 137 miljarder kronor, varav 20 procent utgjordes av servicerelaterade tjänster. Scania grundades 1891 och finns idag representerat i mer än 100 länder, och har drygt 52 000 medarbetare. Forskning och utveckling är koncentrerad till Sverige, med filialer i Brasilien och Indien. Produktion sker i Europa, Latinamerika och Asien, med regionala produktcentra i Afrika, Asien och Eurasien. Scania ingår i TRATON.SE. För ytterligare information, besök www.scania.com.

headline: DevOps Manager
description.text:
DigitalRoute helps hundreds of enterprises across a variety of industries worldwide to capitalize on the growing wave of consumption based commerce with our Usage Data Platform. DigitalRoute has been the market leader in this space, historically called billing mediation, for nearly 20 years. Over 350 leading companies worldwide use DigitalRoute Usage Data Platform to provide accurate complex usage-based business models. Our customers trust our technology to operate in the critical area of monetization.

We are a global company of 200 employees. We are headquartered in Stockholm and have offices all around the globe, from Kuala Lumpur to Atlanta. We are Experts - passionate and always seeking to improve. We are Open- minded - disruptive and innovative. We are Committed - customer satisfaction is our goal.

It is highly probable that at some point in time your data has passed through technology from DigitalRoute. If you turn on the heating in your house, travel by airplane, buy a train ticket or make a call with your phone from anywhere in the world! There is a great chance that the company behind these services use our technology to work with their data. You may not know about us, but the companies you trust to provide these daily services certainly do.

Who are you?
You get excited about getting your team to fire on all cylinders in terms of engagement and growth. You get excited about building globally scaling cloud services and you love to solve problems by automatization.

We believe that you…

• Have a background in development so that you understand the challenges your team will face

• Have set up and operated services by measuring and monitoring availability and performance

• Have excellent verbal and written communications skills
• Get a kick out of growing people and boosting employee spirit
• Always think about Security when building or running solutions

As DevOps Manager at DigitalRoute,
You will lead our global DevOps team and take responsibility for the operational backlog, AWS infrastructure setup and L3 support

• Coach your employees and ensure that they all have individual growth plans that are aligned with their passions and our direction as a company
• Work proactively with product mgmt., product architects and the regional delivery teams to be able to plan and distribute the teams work in a structured way
• Create and deliver on DevOps specific KPIs
• Highlight and be communicative around interfaces and work environments that doesn’t work in a fruitful way
• Be part and in some cases own the creation of requirements against other teams as Product, Sales, Delivery etc.
• Participate and represent DevOps and Operations in different internal board, forums and meetings
• Drive projects to create and improve necessary supporting systems and tools
• Follow up and secure that production errors and improvements gets handle and implemented
• Make requirements for further development of the frameworks test, deploy, build etc.
• Owner of monitoring tool setup and way of working


Apply now,

We look forward to you joining us!

Contact details:

headline: DevOps Engineer

Since early 2000 we have supported our clients on a vast number of projects, all over the world. Our consultant pool consists of Swedish and non-Swedish consultants within the fields of embedded systems telecommunication, online solutions and application development. You are a passionate DevOps with solid experience in Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery, looking for a new and interesting project.

We are looking for a DevOps Engineer to join our client's team.

As a DevOps team member, you will develop an automated process for building and testing software and with model-based design and C/C++ code. 

This automated process handles all the required steps for creating and delivering a binary file ready to be downloaded to our cars.You will be a part of a team responsible for deciding the future of our Software Factory with its CI/CD system to support hundreds of developers.

• Maintain and update current scripts/tools to support an evolving software

• Evaluate and develop new tools to support developers

headline: DEVOPS ENGINEER
description.text:
One of our clients is looking for a DevOps Engineer who holds a development background and is passionate about high quality IT-services! In this role, you will work with implementing and maintaining the right tools to ensure smooth and seamless IT-deliveries with high quality. This is done by standardizing processes, stabilizing infrastructure, enabling automation and reducing human intervention. In this role, you will be responsible for the digital development logistics from start to finish as well as for operational IT-services.

These are some of your responsibilities:
-Cloud infrastructure: Automation, configuration, deployment, monitoring
-CI/CD: Automated build, test and deployment of applications and services
-Site Reliability: Design for operational quality, monitoring and maintenance
-Monitoring and sanity checks of IT-services, using metrics to improve performance and quality

-Experience in implementing and maintaining CI/CD pipelines
-Experience in utilizing metrics to drive improvements
-Experience in cloud environments (preferably Azure)
-Hold the ability to collaborate with others, take note of alternate viewpoints and implement the best solution

ABOUT ALTEN
ALTEN is a consulting company that develops and delivers expertise for world-leading companies with consultants in technology, IT and biochemistry. In Sweden, we have over 1 700 employees and work from offices in twelve locations. 
Welcome to read more about us at alten.se

WHAT WE OFFER YOU
Every employee is equally valuable in the success of ALTEN! We are driven by making people grow and develop, which is why we offer you the opportunity to work with what you are truly passionate about. At ALTEN, we have a broad range of assignments at most of the leading companies in Sweden in several different sectors, to make it possible for your wishes to come true. We offer both national and international opportunities and together with your coaching manager, you build your career path so you constantly are able to develop and achieve your goals and dreams!
As a consultant at ALTEN, you will get the genuine team feeling at your assignment but also a wonderful togetherness at ALTEN. All activities are of course optional. Work life balance is our top priority. We also have a collective agreement and other benefits like Pension, Insurances and Wellness grants.

We believe in growing together.


We look forward to receiving your application!

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
Qliro has a track record of delivering new products and services at unmatched speed. We are active in an exciting intersection of the e-commerce, payment and financial services markets. We target both leading online merchants and millions of Nordic consumers seeking superior digital payments and consumer finance products.

We are looking for a Developer Experience Engineer who is passionate about making work smooth and simple for our Engineering organization.

You will be part of a team working in close collaboration with our Engineering organization with the goal to make sure the value our teams are creating can be delivered to production as early and safely as possible. Together with your team, you are responsible for continuously figuring out what you can do to make the most impact towards this goal. 

At Qliro we want our Engineering teams to take full ownership of their products and to be able to deliver value safely and continuously. 

What you will do

 Inspire the teams with your passion for automation and continuous delivery

 Support the teams in designing systems that ensure safe and fast deliveries to production

You will work with tools such as:

 Linux, Ansible

 Docker SWARM

 HAProxy

 ELK

 Git, Octopus, Proget

Who are we looking for?

 As a person, we expect you to be enthusiastic, proactive and eager to share your expertise.



 Experience in automation using Ansible

 Experience with Docker Containerization

Perks

Qliro offers a dynamic and fast-paced Fintech environment with teams of driven and flexible individuals. We thrive on challenges, personal growth and you will be able to excel within the company. We have a learning and development focused environment with an emphasis on knowledge sharing and training. We work hard to create a workplace that is diverse and inclusive, where you can have a great work-life balance and love the work you do.

We’ll provide you with an attractive salary, pension and insurance plan along with 30 days’ annual leave. What more? At the office you can to enjoy our Thursday breakfast buffet together with all our amazing colleagues, regular mindfulness sessions and a sports hour every week.

WOW in everything we do

We are currently transforming Qliro to cater for both the next levels of payment services to consumers and merchants as well as becoming a Digital Banking Platform. We do that by embracing technology, leverage partnerships, accelerate through data, empower sustainability, and drive outstanding consumer experience. Our goal is to be known as a trusted partner to merchants and to provide an exceptional digital banking experience for consumers - simply WOW.

As a team member, "a Qliroer," you will be offered to work in a dynamic and fast-paced Fintech environment. We thrive on challenges, personal growth and we have a culture that emphasizes learning and development embracing our core values. We believe that through collaboration and our everyday curiosity, we feel empowered and can take accountability. Together we work hard to create a workplace that is diverse and inclusive. We strive to empower our people to manage their time and work effectively and, wherever possible. We promote flexible working hours to help you juggle your everyday life and love the work you do.

headline: DevOps engineer
description.text:
Innovative DevOps engineer for embedded products

About you


About the position
You will support the product development teams with all the tools and services needed to efficiently develop their products in a continuous delivery fashion, managing the delivery pipeline including builds, deployments, automated tests and hosting test environments for different types of tests.

Your responsibilities will be to:
- Design, deploy and manage continuous integration systems that include automated testing and automated notification of results.
- Provide day-to-day support to manage development tools, code repositories and utilities.
- Work across functional (development/testing, deployment, systems/infrastructure) and project teams to ensure continuous operation of build and test systems.
- Maintain build environments, build history, and communicate results.
- Improve speed, efficiency and scalability of the continuous integration environment, automating wherever possible.
- Provide continuous integration training as needed.

Competencies:
- Driven, pro-active and focused on the solutions
- Tolerant to stress and rapid changes
- Committed and passionate about agile system operation

headline: Producer DevOps
description.text:
Avalanche Studios are looking for a self-motivated Producer to run the DevOps team in our Stockholm studio. You will be responsible for the DevOps team, a team that runs cross-game and cross-division, including Release Managers, DevOps managers, Build Engineers and Tools Engineers. This team is currently in the early stages and we foresee this growing over the next few years. As DevOps Producer you would report to the Directors of Development (for both Self-Publishing Divisions).

Production Responsibilities
DevOps Specific
Incident response point of contact for the studio
Live health monitoring and response point of contact
Documentation and cultivation of processes (eg communication)


Task Management
Division Planning (Responsible for working with and building schedules for Devops Team members)
Schedule: approval, greenlight, phase shifts for game projects
Resource optimisation for DevOps


Team Management
Roadmap for Devops team
Personnel Management
Finding and organising education and training opportunities
Budgeting per quarter



Required Qualifications:
At least 2 years experience as a Producer within the games industry
Excellent listening and communication skills

Has directly managed people
Experience identifying risks and providing mitigation plans



Beneficial Qualifications:
Experience working with Development Operations
Release Management teams
Knowledge of games production cycles



In the cover letter you should include why you want to work at Avalanche. Apply as soon as possible as we review applications continuously. All further information is provided under non-disclosure agreement only. All applicants are required to relocate to work full-time in Stockholm, Sweden.


Our Values
At Avalanche Studios, we believe in worlds without limits, and we are committed to developing a diverse and inclusive workplace. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. Being part of our world is not contingent on where you’re from, your gender, or sexual orientation. It’s all about your passion, courage and craftsmanship.


Stockholm Studio
Our state of the art studio is located in the beautiful area of Södermalm, in the center of Stockholm and the Game industry Hub. Our studio is a beautiful place inspired by our catalog of games. We hope you’ll come to think of this place as your home turf and creative foundation.


Avalanche Studios
Interactive) and Rage 2 (published by Bethesda Softworks). Learn more at www.avalanchestudios.com.

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
Rocker, formerly known as Bynk, is looking for a skilled DevOps Automation Engineer who wants to be involved in building Sweden's next big success in the financial sector! You will be given a lot of responsibility, so we are looking for professionals with 4-5 years of work experience in the field of Development & Operations.

What you'll do:

- Deploy, monitor and troubleshoot microservices and security policies in multiple environments
- Design “Infrastructure-as-Code” to define the existing infrastructure
- Think & architect for reuse, growth and scale
- Design test environments for microservices
- Design and maintain, monitoring and alert services for multiple environments
- Manage a set of constantly changing priorities in a high paced, sometimes borderline chaotic, environment


What you'll need:

- Live and breathe the idea of “Infrastructure-as-Code”
- Passion for automation & a mindset to automate everything
- Extensive knowledge of Docker and Container Orchestration (Kubernetes)
- Experience with creating buy-in from tech teams regarding CI/CD & relevant automation techniques

- Familiar with monitoring tools and incident management platforms
- Experience with running large scale systems in production
- Hands-on Experience with GCP or AWS
- Understanding of Terraform



We also value

- Ability to use a wide variety of open source technologies
- Interest in researching new trends in DevOps & configuration management
- Knowledge of best practices in DevOps
- Experience of working with Scala (Java), Elixir (Erlang), Akka or Kafka

At our dog-friendly office in central Stockholm, you will find a mix of powerful tech and fantastic people.

headline: DEVOPS ARCHITECT
description.text:
ALTEN IT Stockholm is now looking for a skilled Senior DevOps Engineer or DevOps Architect ready to take the next step in their career. For this long-term assignment, you will play a major role in developing ALTEN’s growth and partnership with one of our biggest clients´ within the Transportation Industry. You will be responsible for coaching a team of skilled Software -and DevOps engineers at ALTEN’s head office in Stockholm, have a close collaboration with stakeholders, ALTEN IT Business Unit and ALTEN’s Technical Unit Management Team. Emphasis will be placed on personal suitability, technical knowledge and analytical skills.

Your main responsibilities will include:

- Identifying business requirements of our client, negotiate and design interfaces together with external parties and stakeholders
- Set up of best practice processes and coaching the project teams
- Introduce Continuous Delivery into the teams
- Designing the entire DevOps environment from bottom to top (IoT/embedded – cloud) based on the client´s requirements
- Choosing the system architecture and each individual component of the chosen system
- SW test strategy, the enforcement of it and the creation and maintenance of test environments in which automated tests are executed
- Choosing the technologies for the implementation of each component and connections between the components
- Code review and controlling the architecture during iteration of system release
- Writing project documentation and its support

It is therefore required that you possess the following skills:

- Experience in DevOps in production environment
- Experience in CI/CD (Jenkins, Kubernetes, Docker, Terraform, Spinnaker, Helm)
- Experience in interface design in SOA, loosely coupled architecture at the enterprise level
- Experience in designing Micro Services

- Experience in Enterprise busses / API GW
- Experience in Test Automation
- Experience in IoT Architecture and software stacks

- Master’s degree in science

headline: Senior DevOps Engineer
description.text: SG Digital is a division of Scientific Games, which includes OpenBet Ltd as a subsidiary leads the global gaming market, providing innovative software that powers the world’s most successful operators and online gaming providers.      We pride ourselves on product innovation and technical excellence and are constantly adding new applications and new functionality to our product suite, used by billions of end users.Having recently become the Digital, online Division of the $4bn Scientific Games, we are now in a period of dramatic growth that will see us grow headcount by 30% this year alone.      Want to be part of our story?      We are a group of distributed multidisciplinary engineers, passionate about casino gaming, focused on a few highly scalable distributed platforms on a hybrid technology stack running in public and private clouds.      The teams are small and move fast -- all members are expected to be able to achieve maximum results with minimal direction.      Job Description   The DevOps Engineer role will be key to the SG Digital New Product Development (NPD) team.Working alongside others within the central DevOps team and across the New Product Development team you will deliver the changes to our software delivery processes needed that will drive forward this strategic initiative.The NPD team is aggressively adopting new technologies and architectural principles, as well as approaches to delivery, deployment, scalability and monitoring.The successful candidate is expected to be a strong technologist, with both software engineering and technical operations backgrounds.      The NPD team structure continues to evolve, so a "can do" attitude and out-of-the-box thinking will be prerequisites!      Key Tasks      - Work within the team of DevOps Engineers focused primarily on delivering technical solutions for improving the overall quality of product build, deployments, monitoring and alerting, with emphasis on NFRs (resilience, stability, scalability, security etc.)   - Help ensure that NPD test environments managed by DevOps are effectively managed.   - Help implement a CI / CD strategy to incorporate the entire product development lifecycle as well as the continual evolution of cross functional collaboration, associated best practices, and standards   - Help ensure all underlying technologies (open source software, commercial software, frameworks etc.)used across NPD teams have a clear version deprecation and upgrade path   - Create accurate documentation for use by the Development, QA, Technical Operations, Product, Support, and Customer teams   - Work on ongoing R&D effort into tools, processes, and people to further enhance DevOps capabilities   - Help manage consistent application of the DevOps methodologies amongst the NPD team   - Help ensure security considerations are robustly incorporated into NPD deliverables from day one   - Participate in defining and prioritising a backlog of work for the team.   - Participate in a support rota   - Ensure the provisioning of all our environments are fully automated and tested.   - Ensure the right level of visibility on environment health by exposing the required metrics.      Qualifications   - Hands-on experience in all facets of automation and systems architecture, with particular focus on Linux and open source technologies   - Commercial hands-on software development or systems architecture, implementation and ongoing automation experience in a previous role   - Experience with automation and the development processes in general.   - Experience with orchestration and configuration management tooling at scale, preferably Ansible   - Experience with Python or more general purpose programming language (e.g.Ruby, Go, C, C++)   - Experience with metrics collection platforms, Prometheus or similar      - Knowledge of both relational databases and various NoSQL based data storage solutions   - Demonstrable experience with agile methodologies and tools for development and operations   - Well versed and experienced with open source tools commonly used to build continuous integration / delivery solutions, such as Git, Maven, Gradle, Jenkins and Sonar   - Practical knowledge of the Docker container platform      Why would you enjoy working with us at SG Digital?      - Competitive salary and benefits, an open and supportive environment as well as a modern and exciting workplace   - The opportunity to interact with global teams on a regular basis and the possibility to switch teams and projects as you and our business continues to develop and grow   - Tangible and genuine development - at SG Digital, you can take your career where you want it to go!   - Exposure to real work, business-critical projects and the chance to develop some of the world’s leading e-commerce sportsbooks whilst working on exciting client projects and interact with lots of code!      And if that’s not enough; you will get to enjoy a stunning work location and flexible working whilst we provide you with the guidance and development skills you need to progress quickly and enhance your career.

description.text: Presentation av UCG UCG/Radio Support är ett konsultbolag för tjänster inom IT och elektronik/telekom.Vi har kontor i Kista i norra Stockholm men är verksamma över hela landet.Vissa av våra annonserade tjänster är placerade utomlands, främst i Norge och Danmark.Oavsett tjänstens placering så blir du anställd av UCG, med svenska anställningsvillkor och svensk lön.Konsultrollen Som konsult får du möjlighet att arbeta på flera olika arbetsplatser och med många olika system och tekniker.UCG bistår med vidareutbildning, men du behöver i allmänhet ha erfarenhet av kundens system innan vi kan placera dig där.Din arbetsplats är förlagd hos kunden vilket ger spännande möten men också ställer krav på flexibilitet och social kompetens.Utbildning Våra roller kräver teknisk grundutbildning, och teknisk högskoleutbildning är ofta ett krav.Man kan också ha gått den långa vägen med då krävs rejält med erfarenhet.Erfarenhet Du ska ha minst tre års relevant yrkeserfarenhet för alla våra roller.KompetenskravErfarenhet av arbete som Devops teknikerErfarenhet av arbete i Linux miljöErfarenhet av Ansible, GitErfarenhet av CDN och Varnish- Goda kunskaper inom nätverksteknikArbetsspråk: svenska, engelskaMeriterande- Kan anlysera data med hjälp av ELK/GrafanaTillträde ASAPDenna tjänst är placerad i StockholmJobbeskrivningSom DevOps ingenjör hos vår kund i Kista kommer du ingå i ett team som utvecklar och driftar alla kundens TV tjänster.Till deras video distributionsteam söker vi nu en devops ingenjör för drift och utveckling av deras Video CDN som är uppbyggt av en distribuerad två lagers cache baserad på Varnish.Vi tar endast emot ansökningar via e-post och vill att du skickar från din egen e-postadress, då blir det enklare för oss.Vi undanber oss kontakter från försäljare.

headline: DevOps Software Engineer
description.text: Dina huvuduppgifter som DevOps Software Engineer på GE Healthcare i Uppsala är att designa, implementera, underhålla och optimera den miljö som används för mjukvaruutveckling, byggnad och distribution.Utvecklingsmiljön är Windows-baserad.    Du kommer att ingå i ett team som är huvudnavet för all programutveckling som sker på vår FoU-avdelning.Det betyder att teamarbete är viktigt eftersom utmaningar kommer från alla håll.Du och teamet hjälper varandra att underhålla och utveckla vår miljö så att utvecklarteamen kan bygga/testa/släppa ny programvara på ett effektivt sätt.   Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter:   Vår avdelning utvecklar programvara som används av universitet och läkemedelsföretag för upptäckt och utveckling av biologiska läkemedel för att bekämpa sjukdomar som cancer och diabetes.   Eftersom vår övergång till molnbaserade lösningar pågår kommer du att spela en viktig roll i denna övergång och ha möjlighet att påverka inriktning och slutresultat.    Arbetsuppgifter kommer i huvudsak bestå av:   Drift, support och optimering av CI-miljönCloud infrastruktur: automatisering, konfiguration och övervakningCI/CD: som en del av teamet utveckla och underhålla automatiska byggen, test och driftsättningar   Sista ansökningsdag: 10 januari 2020.       Vänligen notera att denna roll kommer att ligga inom ramen för den föreslagna övergången av GE Biopharma till Danaher och kommer att övergå till Danaher när denna transaktion slutförs.   Candidates should note that this role will be in scope for the proposed transition of GE Biopharma to Danaher and will transfer to Danaher at close of this transaction.       Kvalifikationer:   Utmärkta kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både tal ock skriftExamen i datavetenskap eller liknandeNågra års erfarenhet från professionell programvaruutveckling (C # .NET och GIT)Erfarenhet från DevOps-positionErfarenhet och kunskap i att arbeta i en smidig utvecklingsmiljöArbetstillstånd för EU   Önskvärda egenskaper:   Erfarenhet från att arbeta med Azure DevOps.Intresse och erfarenhet från att utveckla och underhålla automatiska bygg- och smoketester.Erfarenhet från automatiserad GUI-testning.Att få saker att fungera smidigt, men samtidigt inse att verkligheten är allt annat än smidig hela tiden.Att vara serviceinriktad och lösningsorienterad kommer definitivt att hjälpa till att utmärka sig i denna roll

headline: DevOps Developer (306449)
description.text: Overall information:   Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) is a critical component in most of Ericsson’s business flows.PLM enables product information creation and usage during Development, Manufacturing, Sales, Delivery and Support and includes people, ways of working, business capabilities, applications, data and technology.A continued digital transformation of Ericsson’s PLM solution is vital for our ability to continue to evolve our business models, explore new ways of engaging with customers and enable smarter product development and manufacturing.         Business Area Networks (BNEW) has been given the corporate responsibility for Development, Delivery and Operation of Ericsson’s PLM system which includes the digital transformation of the PLM solution.        We are now establishing the organization that will enable this PLM transformation.Our ambitions are high and we are looking for you who has experience from larger PLM transformations and PLM solutioning as well as you who recently have graduated with a interest for development in the sense of creating solutions.    We need a variety of skills, you may not yet master all of them, but some, and you are interested to learn new.Our target is to define, implement, verify and integrate a solution consisting of a set of product modules, supporting the business needs.We expect you to come with a mindset fit for Devops where you will contribute in any aspect you are capable of, and where reaching the common goal is our guiding star in the everyday work.We work with cross functional teams with agile methodologies.    If you are curious, open minded, and eager to drive high impact changes in close cooperation with the entire Ericsson organization – and make our PLM transformation a true success – then we welcome your application.        Responsibilities:    The ultimate responsibility is to contribute to a robust, easy-to-use and easy-to-operate & develop PLM solution together with our partnersYou will develop code, integrate & configure systems and solutions in one of our PLM projectsWe expect you to contribute with your current strengths and to build new skills and competences together with us in a Devops set up.       Key Qualifications:   Masters Degree in ICT or Computer Science.  Programming and scripting skillsIntegration and Configuration skillsTeam player mindsetAnalytical problem solver and creative thinkerYou enable speed in development by ensuring high quality and simplicity       Application:   Please send in your application in english as soon as possible since the process is ongoing.       Why is Ericsson a good place to work?   Ericsson enables communications service providers to capture the full value of connectivity.The company’s portfolio spans Networks, Digital Services, Managed Services, and Emerging Business and is designed to help our customers go digital, increase efficiency, find new revenue streams, and create new user experiences.Ericsson’s investments in innovation have delivered the benefits of telephony and mobile broadband to billions of people around the world ensuring our solutions – and our customers – are at the forefront of innovation. We support networks that connect more than 2.5 billion subscribers.With close to 100,000 employees and customers in 180 countries, we combine global scale with technology and service leadership. 40 percent of the world’s mobile traffic is carried over an Ericsson network. And, our Technology for Good and Connect to Learn programs include creating technology that makes it easier to save lives, feed societies, bring technology to emerging markets and connectivity to remote areas, and grow businesses and prosperity.   At Ericsson, we give our employees the freedom to think big and navigate their career, on a global scale. We create technology that helps others, from helping people enjoy their favorite content to helping people recover from natural disasters by enabling better communications between rescue workers.Your ideas and innovations can turn into achievements that impact society and change the world, creating new connections, new possibilities, and new capabilities. We find that Ericsson is at its best when we bring together the diverse skills of our people.Working across business areas, across cultures, across geographical borders, across technical disciplines.Often, across ground-breaking solutions.Next generation technology can be staggeringly complex.But the simpler it is to use; the more people benefit from it.Join us and help build technology that makes it simple to connect with information, business, societies, and each other.

headline: Mjukvaruutvecklare - DevOps
description.text: Om dig   Du som söker är ständigt hungrig på att lära dig mer om hur man kan effektivisera infrastrukturen kring mjukvaruutveckling och motiveras av att få genomföra och se förändringarnas resultat.Vi värderar dina personliga egenskaper högt.För att lyckas i arbetet måste du ha en förmåga att förstå helheten och identifiera ingående delar som behöver förbättras.   Om rollen   Vi söker dig som hittar effektiva lösningar och sätter ett högt värde på att kunna leverera mjukvara snabbt, ofta och smidigt.Genom att samarbeta med utvecklingsteamen, QA och våra kunder kommer du få chansen att bli en nyckelspelare med stora möjligheter att påverka både de interna och externa processer som genererar värde för våra användare.Organisationen finns i Sverige men även i andra länder, vilket gör att kommunikation och samarbete är en viktig del av arbetet.   Dina arbetsuppgifter   Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer bestå i att bland annat administrera och utveckla molnlösningar på AWS och Azure (Docker, Kubernetes), ansvara för att hålla CI-processen uppdaterad och ha en förståelse för hur vårt REST API kan struktureras på bästa sätt för att möta morgondagens behov.   Att programmera i C# och att använda Git är naturligt för dig.Du väljer gärna YAML över JSON och ser att framtiden innebär en spännande anpassning till .NET Core och .NET Standard.När det kommer till automatisering trivs du i CLTs för on-prem såväl som i molnet.   Om företaget   StruSoft AB är ett programutvecklingsföretag med målet att förse byggbranschen med bästa möjliga mjukvara.Förutom utveckling och försäljning av programvara arbetar StruSoft med forskning, support och utbildning.StruSoft bildades 2002 av 13 medarbetare från Skanska IT Solutions.   Idag är StruSoft ett lönsamt och dynamiskt växande företag med ca 100 anställda i 6 länder, med egen programutveckling i Sverige, Danmark, Ungern och Indien.StruSofts program är väl etablerade på marknaden, och används idag av fler än 10.000 användare i mer än 20 länder runt om i världen.   Om programmet   IMPACT är en programvara som sammanför design, produktion och projekt för en prefabricerad betongstomme i realtid.För design används Revit, Tekla, AutoCAD och BricsCAD som grafiska plattformar.Dessa integreras via en webbtjänst med egenutvecklad grafisk plattform för projekt, produktion, logistik och mobila enheter.   I Sverige, Norge och Danmark är programmet marknadsledande och används av både konsulter och fabriker.Programmet är också etablerat i övriga Europa, Mellanöstern och Asien.   Kontakt

description.text: Vi rekryterar Linux-specialister med erfarenhet av DevOpsuppgifter.   Du kommer att vara en viktig del av Lexhers konsultorganisation med fokus på att utveckla och förvalta Linux miljöer som stödjer utvecklare.Hos oss kommer du även att uppmuntras att lära dig mera om Red Hats lösningar som OpenShift, Ansible, CloudForms n.m.   Beskrivning av arbetsuppgifter:   Installation, konfiguration och övervakning av servrar, applikationer, databaser, nätverk inklusive moln miljöer   Delta i byggandet av verktyg och processer för att stödja infrastrukturen,   Utveckla automationslösningar för servrar, nätverk och applikationer   Hantera automationsprocesser för operativa arbetsflöden   Bygga och hantera utvecklings- och testmiljöer, hjälpa utvecklare att felsöka applikationsproblem   felsöka och lösa plattforms och / eller systemproblem   Kvalifikationer:      Minst 3 års erfarenhet av administration i Redhat Linux miljö   Minst 1 års erfarenhet av att jobba i verktyg som Ansible och eller Puppet   goda kunskaper i python   erfarenhet av Linux Containers   erfarenhet av Kubernetes   erfarenhet av versionshantering med hjälp av git, perforce, svn eller liknande   erfarenhet av verktyg som Jenkins, teamcity, maven eller liknande   Grundläggande förståelse för mjukvaruutveckling   Meriterande:   RHCE certifiering – Red Hat Certified Engineer   RHCSA certifiering – Red Hat Certified System Administrator   erfarenhet från Red Hat OpenStack (RHOS)   erfarenhet Red Hat OpenShift   erfarenhet av Red Hat Satellite   erfarenhet av att jobba med OpenStack i någon form   erfarenhet av Red Hat Storage   Övrigt:   Vi värdesätter att du är ordningsam och har en positiv attityd   Du trivs att arbeta både individuellt och tillsammans med andra i projekt   Konsultmässig i ditt arbetssätt, dvs har förmågan att samarbeta med kunder, uppdragsgivare och kollegor.   Urval sker löpande!   Om Lexher:   Startade 2007 med en idé om att förse svenska hem med IT Support on-demand.Idag konsultverksamhet med egen labmiljö och egna utbildningar.   Affärside: Attrahera högkompetenta medarbetare genom en tydlig teknisk inriktning och fokus på ständig kompetensutveckling.Hjälpa våra kunder genom att tillföra denna kärnkompetens till deras IT verksamhet.      Fokus: Tillväxt, utveckling och framsyn.Vi bygger Sveriges största team med Linux|Unix|Devops|IP Nät kompetens och söker dig som är eller vill bli expert inom dessa områden!
